title: 99% awesome
comment:
This phone is almost completely awesome. When I say Almost, it's because there are a few things I miss about webOS. I previously had an HP pre 2. The main thing I miss is pre-dialing. webOS has a pre-dial feature which lets you set what to pre dial if you dial less than 7 numbers.
But enough about that.
This phone is so awesome, there are now 3 of them in my household.
Things I like:
Swipe shortcuts on the lock screen. These are customizeable and allow you to launch things like the dialer, camera, etc. as you unlock it.
Big Screen. Some people are put off by the 5 inch screen, but as an aging myopic, I love it.
Additional storage and removable battery rank high with me.
I can't believe it's considered "aging" but newer phones are already out. The Note II and various droids now have quad cores or faster cores, but this is quite good. [Verizon SGS3 have a dual core.]
2GB RAM is great too. regardless, this phone is so good and so much better than most phones that are out, I don't think anyone will be disappointed with it.
With all it has, you would expect it to be heavy. It's not! Even inside its otterbox it is very light.

The case isn't so great. But I don't care because I don't carry it undressed. I carry it in an Otterbox Defender Case all of the time and recommend it.

I bet you think I recommend this phone. Well, you're right. It's so easy to use and feature rich, I recommend it to anyone. Don't judge it's size too quickly.

title: Best smartphone I have ever used
comment: There are so many things to like about this phone. It integrated easily into my home network. I use a WD TV Live box on my main TV(55" Sony LED). One night I recorded a video of my dog on my phone and while I was watching the playback I noticed a new icon on the top of the screen labeled "send to other device". I pressed the icon and the video on my phone appeared on my TV in full 1080P. It looked fantastic and it was so seamless. I also found this icon appeared for pictures also. Samsung also has software on the phone called Kies. It allows complete and total access to your smartphone though any web browser on your local network. It allowed me to copy video and pictures to my smartphone wirelessly. You can also download the Kies software to your PC from Samsung and it looks and works just like iTunes.

title: S3 is perfect for work/play
comment:
This phone is amazing. The camera is amazing, the resolution is amazing, the images and videos are crisp in HD, screen size is perfect and fits in my skinny jeans (i'm a guy), it's running on Android OS so you can customize everything about the phone, and this phone is extremely fast.

However, there is one major flaw. As the S3 has the ability to run so many things as compared to the iPhone, it eventually takes it toll. After a year with my S3, the OS starts to get choppy and laggy, and texting becomes troublesome as the OS would not recognize your touch response without a .5 second lag.

The pros definitely out weigh the cons. However, if you're looking for an average phone with a high price point, get the iPhone. If you want a unique phone with above average quality, go for the S3.

title: Great upgrade from HTC Incredible
comment: Having a short battery life with my HTC Incredible was my primary motivation to upgrade. It came down to this phone or the Motorola Droid RAZR Maxx HD. Both offered potential full day use without recharging. My son owns the Motorola and has no issues with it. Since they are equally raved about, my decision points were cost - the Samsung being $100 cheaper - and battery configuration. If need be, the battery in the Samsung can be replaced by the owner, or pulled if a hard reboot becomes necessary. The Motorola does not have a removable battery. I've had the phone for 2 months and so far have no complaints. It does everything I want, and more, and I never worry now about running down the battery. An added plus is the speed of downloads. This phone operates on the 4G Verizon network and is very quick compared to my older phone.

Since I have a Galaxy Tab, I figured the S3 would be similar in terms of configuration and layout, which it was. The S3 is far superior to my old smartphone (a Motorola Droid 2) in every way (except battery life) and is beautiful to behold. Blazingly fast, crisp display, gorgeous screen....what's not to love? I don't need or use all the bells and whistles (e.g., NFC, Allshare, etc), but can still appreciate the various additions that have made this phone a contender for the top spot in the market.

title: A great workhorse for people on the go
comment:
After lugging around a 15-inch MacBook Pro for work, my shoulders needed a break. I switched to the 11-inch 2012 MacBook Air and while I enjoyed the notebook's portable form factor, I missed having a built-in card reader and needed something with more storage and a little more screen real estate.

Once Apple announced its refreshed MacBook Airs, I quickly set my sights on the 13-inch model due to the fact that it retained its predecessor's solid build quality, while drastically improving its performance and battery life.

The 2013 Air sports a fourth-generation Intel Haswell processor, which gives the new 13-inch MacBook Air 12 hours of battery life. While it may sound like a marketing gimmick, the updated Air delivers on this claim. In fact, its battery can easily exceed 12 hours of work.

Arguably the second big draw for the updated MacBook Air is its improved flash memory, which Apple claims is over 40 percent better than last year's model. Boot times were noticeably quicker and data reads and writes are considerably faster.

Aside from the aforementioned highlights, the 2013 13-inch MacBook Air's biggest shortcoming is its display. It's not terrible, but in a market saturated with high-res displays, the Air's screen is easily outclassed by many of its competitors.

That being said, if you're not the type to obsess over pixel density and you're looking for a solid machine that will get you through a day at the office or classroom, the 2013 MacBook Air is definitely a worthy contender.

title: Excellent Smartphone
comment:
I love this phone. My wife has an iPhone and I had an iTouch along with a regular (nonsmart) phone. I just liked the iPhone and apple OS but it was boring and conventional; its something you just get accustomed to . I had a difficult time typing/texting with my larger hands/fingers on the iPhone so when I held the store demo Galaxy phone, it felt very comfortable in my hands and was a perfect size. The screen is much larger while the phone is very light and thin, fitting easily in a pocket or purse.
The Android OS is very intuitive and does everything you could possible want it to do, better than the iPhone in my opinion. As someone that really uses numerous features of a device, the Galaxy provides just that and beyond. I even found the calendar and contacts to be much better than the very simple, plain looking app native to the iPhone.
I do have to admit, Apple has a better looking music program than the Galaxy, however the galaxy plays music with great clarity and ease, its just a very basic looking program, not a big deal honestly. There's no Facetime but Skype is available.
As a tech enthusiast I highly recommend this phone. Its intuitive enough for the casual user but even more rewarding in the hands of someone that is tech savvy. Voice commands work better than Apple's, customization is vast, just keep a charger handy and turn off background activity as it will drain your battery quickly. Take the time to do this as it will double your battery life. Buy this phone!

You're then on your own to figure it out. The volume on my phone, even though set to the highest setting isn't loud. In a quiet space it can be heard but in a noisy environment I miss all the calls. Using the phone outside in the sunlight is almost impossible. The screen can't be seen in the sunlight. You'll need to move to a shaded area which helps a little to see the screen. When composing a text message the phone limits your text in characters that can be entered. If you exceed the amount of allowable entered characters your text is wiped out and you'll need to start over again. The speaker feature for composing a text is very helpful. Just need to check your text for correct spelling before sending. Other then these above mentioned issues the more I get to know how to use the phone it is quite impressive. I would recommend this phone to other people and when I'm ready for another phone I would certainly consider purchasing the newest model of this phone.

title: Perfect laptop for everyone
comment:
I've had a Dell laptop for about 4 years and also had a Dell Desktop. Wanted to switch over to Mac, as many friends who owned PCs had told me that the new Windows 8 operating system was a bit weird and unmanageable. The only thing I worried about was the Wifi issues that many people had complained about. At first, I was hesitant to go for the Air, and wanted to try the pro instead, however the pro with retina was about 400 dollars more expensive at the time, and also was a bit heavier than the air. Since I am starting out in the fall as a college student, I wanted a super light weight portable laptop that I could carry around without having to worry about breaking.
Despite the many reviews about the Wifi having issues, I splurged and bought it. I have had no issues with ANY Wifi connections so far, and the internet moves faster than my old PC even though they are connected to the same Wifi. Overall, the laptop is super easy to use, even for beginners, and if you have an iPhone or an iPad, you can do SO much with both devices. I can talk to my friends via iMessage not only on my iPhone now, but also on my Macbook and email notifications are so much easier. Before, I used to have to open Chrome/Internet and then login to my email every time. Now, everything is within a simple click on the dock, and all the apps are within easy reach. Although the Mac is very different from the PC, it didn't take me too long to get used to using OS operating system. Everything is super easy and fast, and setup took only a few minutes.
Also, the battery life is indeed amazing. Apple promised 12 hours of battery life on the new Air, and although I have not kept track of my usage hours, I have to say that it is a pretty strong battery life. On my Dell pc, I could barely go 2 hours without having to plug it in. I have used my new Macbook Air for about 5 days now, and only had to charge it once. It was only charged for a little amount of time before the battery was full. Also, when I shut down the Air, and leave it off for a few days, the battery life remains the same. As for the Dell, I would charge it 100% and turn it off, but within a day the battery would drop down to 95% just from turning it on.
Overall, it is hard to explain every single detail about the Macbook Air here, but it is definitely worth it. I would recommend this is any college student, or even high school students who want a simple laptop that is super manageable and easy to use. It turns on within 10 seconds, and also shuts off very quickly. The only thing I would say is that the price is a bit high for a laptop, but sometimes there are discounts and sales. Got mine for 50$ off sale, and an additional 100$ off student discount. :)

title: Best apple laptop available for students
comment:
I own a macbook pro and an iMac (27') but decided to update my macbook pro with the new Macbook air. I was skeptical at first but decided to give this option a shot.

I can tell you that this was not only the cheapest option currently available, but also it the most outstanding laptop I could have gotten. The first thin you will notice is the weight which is almost non existent (compared to the macbook pro). There after you will notice the incredible speed, once it is turned on it will change the way you ever see other computer speeds. Booting time happens in a blink of the eye, sleep to on happens before you even get to turn on he computer, and your opinion of loading times will have to be re-evaluated. Now for the battery life, the display stated 14 hours left of battery when I checked it. Even if this was incorrect and the 12 hours advertised will still blow my mind. This means I can go to school, do my work, and still have enough juice to do what I like at the end of the day.

For the complaints I have been reading regarding wireless problems, I do not know if this issue has been patched since, or if I just do not have the same problems? But I have yet to experience any such problems. Not saying its not true, but I have not yet had the agony of this wireless issue.

If you are looking for a solid piece of equipment that will last for years to come, this should be on your list as top contender! I will actually order a second one fully loaded for business use.

I love the camera and it's features, along with the large screen.
The fact that this phone is so customizable is wonderful. You can make it do pretty much whatever you want, as well as create your own visual setup.
With help I downloaded a new Yahoo keyboard that really makes it much easier and faster to use.
My major complaint is the battery life. Regardless of everything I've tried, the battery doesn't last nearly as my iPhone.
After a few months of use I think I'll likely be a convert to windows phones.

comment: with macbook airs finally reaching "normal prices" in the past few years (for premium products), these are finally worth buying. the haswell processor and streamlined pcie SSD allow for much faster processing than the 1.3 ghz leads you to believe. the battery life is amazing and i mean there is nothing like it anywhere else right now without requiring an additional heavy battery. it's so liberating not to carry the ac adaptor. the display is the weakest point of this computer, as it is rather average in resolution and not a touch screen, but i have no need for fancy graphics or touch interface. now just waiting on mavericks os x to come out...

title: Premium price, but missing some features
comment:
I owned a Gateway NV series laptop for the last five years, it was hot, slow, and not dependable. That's why I got the Macbook Air. I'm glad I didn't get the 11 inch screen because that would've been too small. For the extra $100 it's well worth the upgrade to the 13 from the 11. It also has a bigger battery and a couple of more hours of battery life.

It boots up in seconds, it's ultra portable, and feels really premium. The mouse on board is second to none.

It however lacks HDMI and VGA ports. The screen is disappointingly dim without it being plugged in. I'm used to looking at my Nexus 4 all day and looking at this with the brightness turned all the way up is a bit too dim for my liking. I didn't get to play with it in the Anaheim store that I bought it at. Ended up picking it up at another store.

Overall, I hope to get ten good years' use out of it. I figure I could've bought an ASUS with similar specs for half the price, but I know that Apples last a bit longer than most PCs. The biggest draw was the SSD so that my lap wouldn't burn up like it did with my old PC.

If you don't mind it being a bit dim and you don't mind spending extras to get accessories, and portability is a must this is the device for you.

title: Great laptop for self taught users.

title: Now I see what everyone has been raving about
comment:
We love the MacBook Air. I have not had any issues. The battery life, its easy to use and set up. The touch pad or glass as some Mac Geeks call it is really awesome. No need for the mouse you can't live without on a PC Laptop. All the little tricks within the system are great. It works wonderfully with our iPads and IPhone. We don't experience any wifii drops. I could not be happier with its performance and features. I have been a pc user for the past 13 years due to work, software, and business issues. But finally after two laptops crapping out in the last year short of the 5 year mark and Windows, all system performance degrading that happens with Windows over time, we decided to splurge. I know the proof comes over
time but the initial impression compared to my dell after a month is night and day. Sure the Air does not have much storage or a DVD burner but that is what the cloud, home network storage, and peripheral add ons are for. We have another computer that has a burner. We have a MyBook Live so the storage is defiantly not a negative especially compared to the Airs weight.

title: Great for sharing
comment: Great for file sharing between computers and wireless printing. Also easy to use for beginners or first time mac users.

title: Nice and easy to use, terrible screen
comment: It's a nifty little phone. I really enjoy the dual window features and the task bar. The camera is nice, but it could be nicer. The call quality is great and rarely does the phone drop a call. The only complaint i have is that the glass is horrible. It cracks so easily. A small drop will shatter the screen, even with a zagg shield and case on the phone. If you are looking to purchase this phone GET THE INSURANCE, your phone will crack. it will be sad

title: lighter, slimmer and sleeker
comment:
After years of being an Windows PC user, I decided to purchase a MacBook Air and I love it! It's portable, fast and works well with my other Apple products. An excellent laptop. Plan to use when I travel because or the sleekness and battery life. The flash hard drive allows the MacBook Air to boot and recover from sleep mode very quickly. If you are looking to buy a new laptop, consider trying a MacBook Air. You could easily write an essay on the MacBook Air explaining how much there is to like about it but in short:
- very thin, light and small
- awesome looks
- amazing trackpad
- back-lit keyboard

title: Super function for my student - more bang per $
comment: Bought the MacBook Air for my son who is a Sr in HS thinking this would be the machine he takes to college. Was originally looking for Windows based notebook since most of his work is in MS program products. Apple offered good deal on MS package software and a server based service that will meet his needs in the future. Plus the apps available gave my son more options than other machines. The speed and reliability were big features plus the 11 hour battery life was super important in the school environment. I never was an Apple fan, but now with all the server based programs available Apple may have the most flexibility and performance for what we use computers for. Also it's nice for his other IOs devices to be fully compatible - I guess next he will be buying his own I-phone and I-Pad just to have the suite!

My biggest gripe is that using it for my primary purpose, as a phone, is awkward. I feel like I'm holding a scientific calculator to my ear. I've had a few problems with some multimedia messaging to groups of friends, but I think that's a carrier issue and not the phone. I hope the next time I have to get a new phone that I don't have to choose from tablets only.

title: Excellent smartphone...

title: Love It! From a Windows person
comment:
I admit, this is my first Mac and I have been a Windows user for 20 years. I am fluent in Windows, Mac is like learning a new language. After one month, I will never go back. I bought a touch screen HP for Windows 8 and upgraded. I wish I could trade that computer and get an iMac now cause it already is much slower and stuff goes wrong all the time on it.

The Mac Book Air is awesome. The battery lasts forever, I charge it like once a week. Love the guestures. It doesn't slow down. The harddrive is solid state so should never crash, and all my apple products communicate nicely now. Highly recommend. It isn't cheap, but for the amount of time I use a computer, it is worth spending the extra money, you won't regret it. Took me 2-3 weeks to get comfortable with all the Mac stuff. It is different, but much better than Windows or Chrome.

title: Totally awesome light weight computer

For such spec configurations, a pc ultrabook is ~$300 less. But this is Apple, you pay more for the brand.

My only complaint is that the battery life, while still really great, in practice doesn't reach what's advertised, especially if you, like me, run multiple cloud services in the background. Turning those off gets much closer to the advertised rate. I was also hoping for a retina screen this round.

The storage capacity is smaller than other similar computers on the market, but nothing compares to the battery life. I do not believe storage space will be an issue with other storage options such as Dropbox. Love this computer!

title: Samsung rocks

Love this phone. I was going to go with a Motorola Droid but was convinced to try the Samsung. Glad I did, Phone is very fast. Screen res is great and the size of the display is nice and bright. The voice commands work great without any problems. Nice and slim case but a bit slippery so must be carful not to drop. The buttons are to easy to press and cause the phone to lock/unlock when I do not want that. Volume button is right where you hold the phone so I am always changing the volume by accident. Battery life is average but not bad, would like to have more. Sound quality is very good as is the screen. Just wish it had the Gorilla Glass but I put on a high quality protector and that should do.
Overall this has been a good choice, time will tell if it remains so

title: Flawless laptop for a college student
comment:
I was always an anti-Mac a few years ago. I always sided with Windows because of the price many companies offered for laptops. There were times where the prices of laptop were less than a premium Macbook and it even offered more internally than the Macbook.
When it comes to computers/laptops, I always look at the specs first and then the quality next. Windows laptops always had the better specs than Macbooks back in a few years ago. Price also was a factor too as Macbooks are still in my opinion a little too much. I know it is business and Apple is still trying to get as much until the people drift away from Macbooks (people are not going to drift away. the Macbooks are just too good).
Nevertheless it might seem the 4GB on this laptop is too small for your tastes, trust me, 4GB is more than enough. The work I've been doing on this laptop is just surfing the web with always 9+ tabs, taking notes with "Evernote", viewing powerpoints, writing paper, etc. I haven't played any games such as LoL or CS:GO, but from videos I've seen this Macbook Air can work like a powerhorse if need be.
The keyboard is simply amazing, I never though I would actually not miss my numeric keyboard. It is simply an awesome experience to use the keyboard.
The trackpad is my favorite part of the Macbook Air. With a large trackpad and the gestures Apple integrated into the Macbook Air, you can do tasks so quickly and efficiently. Switch desktops? Four finger swipe left or right. View your mission control? Four finger swipe up. I am able to do my online Chemistry homework without any problems at all.
The speakers on this Air is remarkable. I don't know how Apple does it but they do it well. Sound quality is above average and the volume can go pretty high.
Screen size is just perfect for me. I was using a 15.6" HP Envy and although I do see a difference in screen size, the 1440x900 makes up for it. Watching American TV shows or Korean variety shows is awesome.
Battery performance is just amazing. I am absolutely thankful to purchase the Macbook Air with the Haswell processor. 12 hours. Yes, 12 hours on a single charge. That's if you have your brightness at like 5-6 ticks. Surfing the web is 12 hours. I once saw the battery remaining at 19 hours while I was viewing a pdf. Simply amazing. One thing that I recommend is to quit applications you don't need so you can maximize your battery life.
Portability is simply amazing. 2.96 lbs. Wow. I'm a college freshmen now and I can tell you that carrying a 4.5+ lbs laptop is heavy already. Add some books and you will experience the worst time of your life. At the college I'm currently attending, the heat and humidity makes your life carrying that laptop inside your backpack just awful. Sweat is on your straps and the back of backpack is just not good.
There have been creaks here and there when I pick up the Air and such. However, I would go ahead and buy a pentalobe screwdriver for Macbook Air and tighten it yourself. The Apple Genius Associate can only do so much to help you. They might help you tighten it a bit more and they might not because it would be useless since it's an exterior manufacturing defect or some sort.
There are times where I would surf on the web and the page would lag for a bit and then fully load. Although it is kind of an annoyance, it is still manageable.
This laptop is amazing. Just amazing. For all of you college students or about to be college students I would definitely recommend this laptop. Even if you've used Windows all of your life (I have), take that leap of faith and go to the "dark side." "Once you go Mac you will never go back." I purchased this laptop at an incredible price, around $200 lower than the retail price. If you can manage to grab a piece of machinery at this price then definitely go for it.
Thanks!

It was a leap from the poor build of a PC and the perpetual hiccups of Windows 8 to the smart and solid design of my Macbook Air and the sensible and smooth-as-butter performance of Mountain Lion. Unlike Windows 8, all the features of Mountain Lion that I've encountered so far actually make sense and help with my productivity. (I use this device for my consulting biz). title: Great overall, but Wifi issues persist
comment:
This really is a great laptop on most metrics, but let's start with the one significant problem - the wifi card (which is a new 802.11ac compatible card) will repeatedly drop you on a lot of network configurations. Unfortunately, I saw this problem repeated across three replacement laptops, various router hardware and configurations, and even after the update issued by Apple that was supposed to fix this problem. It's only irritating for browsing, but it's fatal for video-conferencing. I'm hopeful it will be fixed at some point, but in the interim the less-than-ideal solution is a USB wifi receiver. It seems unlike Apple to miss on something like this, and it's a pity - it mars an otherwise excellent laptop, and it's one of those recurring things which stops you enjoying a new purchase.

And an excellent laptop it is, otherwise. Thin, light, portable. Enough processing power for 95% of users (if you have a niche need - video editing, gaming, etc., - you may want something with a bit more grunt). No retina display on this one, which is a pity bit not a dealbreaker. But that wifi issue...

title: Good Cell Phone/Handheld Computer!
comment:
I purchased this phone out of necessity. I wasn't planning on purchasing this device, and wasn't happy that I had to spend the money initially. With that being said, I'm extremely pleased with this phone, how it operates and how it handles!.

The inboard memory is adequate for what it is: A phone! Being an audiophile, I would have liked more storage space, but this phone offers a MicroSD slot that will accept up to a 64Gb chip. That is fantastic storage size!

The camera on this phone is amazing. I use it primarily to document my job (problems/completions) and have used it under houses in low light, after dark outside as well as in bright conditions and all of the pictures are crystal clear!

The sound quality is superb, but it has a tendency to keep dropping my bluetooth devices mid-call. They find each other eventually and re-connect, but it's still a pain! In point of fact, I can't be sure that the phone is the culprit alone, and not a problem with the bluetooth devices!

My previous personal device was a Motorola RAZR and was so frustrated with the short battery life with that phone, that I was almost SHOCKED when my new phone lasts ALL DAY with heavy use!. Pictures, texts, navigation, music, web browsing and calls and there's still battery life left when I get home at night!

All in all, I'm very pleased with the quality and abilities of this device!

title: AMAZING! I'm a believer!
comment:
For years I have considered getting a Macbook and seriously considered it when the first Macbook Air came out. I had always used a PC and I was not ready to switch everything over. I use this for home but use it a lot for my business. After getting an iPad and my 2nd iPhone, I decided that I could do it and it would be nice to have everything sync together. I have never been happier with a computer purchase! This skinny thing is amazing! The battery DOES last a long time. I charge it up at night, take it to work, and still have enough battery life remaining at night to use it without an issue. Unreal that something with this power can have such amazing battery life.

The switch to Mac was not perfect. There are some definite differences. After a week, however, I feel like I have something down. I love the way this system works and I would never go back to a PC again. Yes, it is pricier, but I know this computer will last. If you have been on the fence, do it! You won't regret it.

It doesn't fit well in small pockets but I can put it in a back pocket and it'll stay there.
Recently, it suddenly 'deleted' the permanent "contacts" icon from my home screen. However, rebooting the phone fixed it.
I've had this phone for about a month now and I'm quite happy with it. I gave it 4 stars only because I haven't had it all that long. I think it's easily a 4.5 so far.

title: Pricy, but it's a slick machine
comment:
I think Macs are a bit pricy, but the MBA is a nice machine. My only regret is not shelling out for more RAM or disk space. The computer has froze on more than one occasion but of course ymmv. It's probably caused by a third-party application.

A couple notes:
- The SSD is VERY fast. Boot-up times are about 10 seconds on average. I only wish I had gotten more disk space as I now have to rely on external storage.
- Dota 2 runs well (with no problem on medium settings, but will get hot on high settings
- Guild Wars 2 runs decently at about 30fps for medium settings, but I couldn't really turn up the settings any more without noticeable lag.
- Keyboard is excellent to type on.
- The MBA is incredibly light.
- Converting from windows to mac only took a couple weeks to get used to. The placement of the fn, control, alt, and command keys take time to adjust to.
- The trackpad is hundreds of times better than any trackpad I've ever used.
- I wish there were more ports.

Overall, it's a nice buy if it's in your budget and fits your needs.

title: Worth the money
comment:
I purchased the Macbook Air for my daughter who needed a lightweight (only 3 lbs) computer for note taking at school. We have had it since mid August 2013.

We watched several movies on it throughout the day while she was recently in the hospital, not to mention quite a bit of internet time as well & I must say the battery life is AMAZING!!

I decided to go with the larger screen & the smaller flash storage & so far that has not been an issue at all. I am a firm believer that you should keep photos, videos, & music on an external hard drive no matter what just because they eat up a lot of storage.

Sure you can purchase a windows laptop for a lot less, but the quality of the computer, the battery life, & the overall life expectancy of the machine won't come close to touching that of a Mac.

I HIGHLY recommend the Macbook Air to anyone!! I like hers so much I will be purchasing another for me in the near future!!

My work requires me to use Windows, so I'll always have a Windows computer in my home, but, for pleasure I'm sticking with the Macbook Air. I really love it!

title: A Great Laptop
comment:
Was torn between replacing my 7 yo MacBook and my 1st Gen iPad. Since a new iPad seems to be imminent, decided to replace the MacBook. Didn't want to spend the money for a Pro (wasn't sure whether I really needed a Pro either), but was concerned about the Air maybe not being powerful enough in comparison, but BB had a great price so decided to give it a try. Transferring data was easy but does require buying a cable.

It's definitely powerful enough, does everything you'd expect from a Mac, but it's incredibly lightweight. I mean incredibly lightweight. Just slip it in the sleeve and into my tote and off I go. You can use one hand to hold it. I worried about taking it places without the brick of a charger, but the battery life is really good. It actually feels like the charger weighs more than the Air. In fact, haven't used the old iPad since I got this and may hold off getting the iPad replacement. Lightweight does not mean really light or flimsy build. It still has a little heft. and does weigh more than an iPad, particularly the new ones.

I got the 13" instead of the 11" because I do photo stuff. However, if I'd gotten the 11", might think about not replacing the iPad for really quite some time. However, if you do a lot of photoshop, video/audio editing and need an ethernet connection, you probably would want something like the Pro with Retina.

I don't miss the the DVD drive as I have an iMac and dropbox/iCloud. The SDHC slot is great to use. The touchpad, something I'm getting used to, is very responsive and natural. I wish it had an ethernet connection, but the wifi is working fine.

People at meetings see it and want to pick it up and play with it. Can't believe that it's that thin and light and still does everything a laptop does.

Very pleased with the decision.

comment: I have always had Windows based laptops, they are slow and take a long time to turn on and get working. The MACBOOK is so fast, easy to use, intuitive and lightweight. I will never buy a Windows based laptop again.

title: I LOVE this product!!!
comment: Have a MacBook Pro and bought the Air, so much faster and does all I need it to do. I don't think I've touched my Pro since I bought the Air. Best Mac ever!!!

title: Easy to Use - Great for a Beginner
comment: Great phone for a beginner! My girlfriend loves this phone and it's her first smartphone. She said she finds it very easy to use.

title: great
comment: Great phone with many features and it is easy to use. Would reccomend toanyone.

title: Great for the price!
comment: Really like this phone. It is my first phone without a slide-out keyboard, and the touch screen keyboard is really sensitive.

title: Great Computer for business
comment: The Air Mac is awesome. It is light, fast, and it looks great. I highly recommend this laptop computer.

title: Great upgrade from S1
comment: Phone is faster and more useable than S1. Too many apps overloaded S1.

title: Great for the busy College Student
comment: Over all the Mac Book air 13' is amazing. I use my mac for everything so this is so convenient that its light weight, I can put it in my book bag or purse, it literally fits everywhere and its so light weight. You won't even notice its there its so light and thin.

title: Best phone I've ever owned
comment: Bought this phone as a replacement for HTC Incredible 2. What a difference! Great quailty phone. Selected the Galaxy SIII even though my daughter just upgraded to the S4. I didn't feel the differences were worth the extra $200 to upgrade. Many places have this phone free with 2 year extension. Battery life is much better than my old phone. I've actually gone multiple days without charging. I do have battery saver settings turned on. Overall I'm very impressed with the phone, which got excellent reviews when it was first released. It has taken me a bit to get used to the texting keyboard, which is slightly different from HTC. Also, can't seem to figure out how to get auto correct to work. HTC was preset to this. Daughter can't figure out how to get feature turned on in S4 either. That's my only complaint.

title: great phone
comment: This phone is easy to use compared to my basic that I use to have.

title: Great smart phone for the price. camera is great.
comment: Phone is great. Would have preferred a different color but this was all that was available. Great camera. Great texting speed due to word prediction software.

title: Best laptop for the money
comment: Where to start, Its a great laptop, super fast, and great battery life. SSD is key here for great performance.

title: Wonderful computer for the price!
comment: Great laptop, works very fast and I loved that there are no moving parts which makes me feel like its a little more durable. The thing is that since there are no moving parts, you have to be really disciplined about turning it on and off and letting it sleep. Or else it will be weird about turning on again. Maybe my specific notebook just has a glitch but that's what I've learned that I have to do or else it makes me restart it just to turn it on.

title: SIMPLY AWSOME
comment: the XBOX 1 is awesome because when you pop in your DVD the clarity of the picture looks stellar like i was there at a bar in the 1750s or other places also the controller is surprising light and easy to handle and control and the way it looks i showed it to my grandma and she said is that a transformer and i laughed.

title: This is so easy for me to use.
comment: I am really enjoying my MacBook Air. It has been easy to use on my wireless internet and I easily figured out how to print from from my photo library. I like that I can save pictures from the internet and sayings I like. I found one that was perfect for a sympathy card I made for a good friend who died.

title: XBox One - Disc Drive Not reading Discs
comment:
I picked up the Xbox One at midnight launch day to find that it would not read Forza Motor Sport 5 or any Blu-ray I had. Saw others online with similar issues.

The initial update only took a few minutes. I had the console running and initial setup complete in about 20 minutes after getting home. Now I am just going to have to do it again when I get a replacement Xbox One with a working disc drive. I think this will be an amazing console once the initial bugs are fixed, but until then, I would rush out to get it or you'll be sorely disappointed.

title: Broken Hardware
comment: I bought this at my local gamestop. I had to stand there for several hours. When I finally got one I was so excited so I got home plugged it in and set it up. When I tried inserting a disc it made a weird sound. The disc couldn't be read. Tried another game, didn't work either. Then the console started making weird noises. I don't think it was the fan. So now I have to wait and see if I can get a refund or something because I don't want a $500 paperweight. Purchase at your own risk as there have been several broken consoles reported.

title: Just Amazing!
comment: It really is something to enjoy even when you dont feel like gaming. Watch TV, listen to music and Skype chat! I actually connected my PC using the HDMI Input behind the Xbox One and It Worked. Good Job Microsoft!

title: Awesome gaming system
comment: It's simply the best thing since cooked food. Amazing gaming and entertainment unit. Worth the extra 100! PS4 is nice but can't stack up to this console!

title: Great
comment: The Samsung Galaxy S3 is a quality phone which offers great sound and picture clarity. The phone handles various apps well, it's a big improvement from the S2.

title: Don't ruin your Christmas
comment: I'm going to start by saying I have owned both the xbox 360 and the ps3 and trust me when I say the 360 was the best console of the two. I assumed that this would continue when I preordered and spent 500 dollars. This is the worst purchase I have ever made. I put in cod ghosts in it and it looks awful. It looks like I am playing the original xbox. The voice command doesn't understand a word that I am saying and I am ready to return this over priced piece of garbage Please beware, xbox is not the best anymore

title: I was one of the unlucky ones.
comment: I had to work but my girlfriend was nice enough to pick this up for me because I wanted it since it was first announced. I am however disappointed because the thing won't read the disc and now I have to either return it or contact Microsoft. I wish they would have checked these better before releasing them but it usually happens with new releases.

title: Great first time smart phone
comment: First smart phone. Bigger display than that "other" phone. For my use, it's been great.

title: Love my Mac Air!!!
comment: I had a Gen 1 Mac Air for years. The laptop still works great and never had any viruses but after 4+ years it would get hot and the hinges stopped holding up the screen. I knew it was time to get a new laptop. I checked out the new Mac Air and Apple had upgraded the hinge. The laptop is so much faster than my poor old Gen 1. I am so glad I got the new Mac Air!

title: one of the best phones ever....
comment: One of the best, always had a Samsung and will continue to use this because they have great features and there functions are also great, such as pictures, sound and video, also use for it as my main music source...g

title: Galaxy SIII 4G is still a great product
comment:
I replaced an older Android product with the Galaxy SIII.
There are other smart phone options like the S4 and Note which I have used and technically supported, yet the S III still holds up well with the newer phone competition. It has great features such as perfect pocket size, great resolution, and tons of compatible apps. It quickly bonded and automatically connects to my 2013 Toyota Highlander for phone and media player via bluetooth. The battery life is acceptable for this type of phone but lasts much longer if you turn off push notifications, wifi, and bluetooth when not needed. Photo quality is awesome. There is no need to take a camera to a birthday party when you have this phone in your pocket. Voice recognition is awesome as it quickly responds to commands like "navigate to Dulles airport", "message john call me" for hands free navigation and texting.

title: Perfect tech companion for travel.
comment: I travel an average of 70% per year to difficult and dangerous places, and the MacBook Air is proving to be my perfect travel companion. It takes up minimal space in my Daypack, meets all my communication, writing, and design needs, and provides recreation when I'm able to find the time. It beats anything I've lugged around for the past 50 years!

title: My Day One Edition Had Problems..
comment: I just returned my day one edition Xbox One, I had a loud grinding noise coming from it after about 4 hours of playing, I am not alone with this problem. I am also not a fan of the windows 8 style home page I much prefer the 360. The system itself runs very slow due to a super slow 5400rpm hard drive (that your stuck with) and cheap ram. While I was originally on board with the all in one idea after using it for a day I can honestly say I was not impressed at all and want no part of it. Installing games takes forever and uses way too much HD space, the Kinect voice commands are a mix bag as they work sometimes but usually don't. I am also not going to be shouting voice commands at 1:00AM when everyone is sleeping. Graphics are not bad but not that huge leap forward most people are expecting, yes they will get a bit better in the next couple years when the devs iron out the kinks but they will never match a good PC. The new controller is actually a step backwards.. It was a good idea to get rid of the battery section but the cheaper buttons on top and overall smaller size is disappointing. In the end good idea poor execution and faulty cheap parts. I honestly think that gaming consoles are finished.. They are trying to become PC's but are just too far behind still. Your better off taking the $500 and building a nice gaming PC which can be upgraded whenever you want rather than waiting another 8 years.

title: Mac rules!
comment: I have to say coming from a PC its just night/day difference. I always wanted into Mac but the price is hard to swallow. If you want a superior product PONY up! Trust me I finally made the jump from PC and wish I would have done this years ago......It's so worth the price tag!

title: Best smartphone I've ever owned
comment:
I recently upgraded from the Motorola to the Samsung family of Android OS phones. I was never happy with my Motorolas, there was always an issue to be had. After much research, about a year's worth, I finally decided to move on from the Motorola family and found that Samsung would be the most ideal choice.

I've had the phone a month now and I can not believe how much easier my life has become. I don't have to wait forever for an app to open, I don't have to wait for my text writing to catch up to what I input. All the stress I had with my last phone has disappeared. I couldn't be happier with my phone! I'm now sold on Samsung quality for my phone and tablet needs!

There are only two real issues I have with this phone so far, but they are minor compared to the other issues I have dealt with on Motorola phones. The speech to text function could use some work. It seems to choose the wrong words when I speak. But, if I find one word messed up I don't have to delete the whole phrase like I had to with Motorola. The other thing is, my phone has difficulty learning my son's name.

I've only had this phone a month, and am still running it through the courses. So far, I've never been happier with any phone in my life than I am with this one. It will take a lot for me to switch from Samsung in the future.

title: Sleek, beautiful, simplicity
comment: A long time PC guy, I was a bit apprehensive moving to Mac but the learning curve is surprisingly level. I love this computer! It is simple to use and if you are a MS application user, don't worry because programs like office are available for Mac. The best thing so far is I don't have to run all that software to protect the computer, antivirus, malware, etc because apparently you don't need it on a Mac. There is a lot of help on the internet as well for new users of Mac so don't worry...make the switch!

title: Great all around laptop
comment: Super light, lightning fast and easy to use. Best laptop ever!

title: Not a finished product
comment: My family uses game consoles more for media consumption than gaming. Netflix, Hulu and DLNA streaming off of our Network Attached Storage (NAS) take up the majority of the run time. I have a PS3, 360 and now after waiting all night in freezing lines an Xbox one. This was only to find that the Xbox One does not support searching or playing local DLNA servers. If you have a Plex or twonky server with your movies stored locally the Xbone will not find or play them. Microsoft claims DLNA support but don't be fooled it is Play to ONLY and that doesn't work very well (I own a surface pro 2 and have tried.) or at all. I am also experiencing intermittent lockups

title: Good phone for someone who wants customization
comment: Switched from an iPhone...love it. More custom options, faster, better camera....

title: DO NOT WASTE $500+ ON THIS
comment: I can't believe I was so hyped for this system. What a let down, $500+ dollars for this? Apart from that it broke after 2 hours, the software is horrible!! I'm going to wait till next year and buy a PS4!

title: Used the Kinect More than I ever thought
comment: I bought this system primarily for Halo, my favorite franchise, and thought that the kinect was just some gimmick I was never going to use. Then shortly after I fond myself using the voice commands all the time to the point that I never thought was possible. I never expected myself to get much enjoyment out of the system, but now I think its one of the best purchases I've ever made.

title: Smart Console
comment: I'm having a blast with the Xbox One. The technology advances are so nice. What I like most is that it incorporates all of the common TV uses into one device. This is an all in one entertainment option and the gaming is great. The XBOX One goes as far as turning your TV and A/V receiver in addition to turning itself on by saying XBOX ON. My Logitech harmony won't be getting much use in the future.

title: amazing
comment: Theres lots to like about xbox one. First are the game exclusives. Im really enjoying dead rising 3, killer instinct, ryse, crimson dragon and forza 5. I also love the apps. So far ive downloaded the skype, machinima, and netflix apps. The one app/game that surprised me was xbox fitness. It has free workout programs such as p90x and insanity. The kinect is utilized with xbox fitness as it tracks your form and your heart rate. I find that technology completely amazing as it suggests that the kinect is technologically advanced enough to detect your heart rate. Im enjoying the ease of voice commands because its faster than using the control or hand gestures. I espcially love thw "xbox record that" voice command because it will record your game play which then u can edit and upload for your friends to see. The kinect also acts like a qr reader. The xbox came with a 2 week gold trial card which I simply had to scan it on the kinect and it awarded me the trial. Thats a life saver as it eliminated inputting 16 digit codes. Last but not least I love the UI... especially my friends list. It has a feed which shows what my my friends are doing or playing or achievements they made similar to facebook news feed. When all is said and done im completely happy with my purchase and with so many other things you can do with xbox I still have other things I have yet to try. I wil defenitly try the smartglass feature where the xbox communicates with any tablet or smartphone and the tv hdmi in pass through feature. Im really happy with my decision to purchase this system as it has a lot to offer.

title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS!
comment: I connected everything & update took me less than 10min. No lag no random shut down everything normal. I love how in 1 sec i can be in a video game then the other browsing the web because I personally love to do more than just play video games. The controller is 10x better than i thought & the xbox amazes me with the smartglass feature it reads my phone sonic fast. As for the kinect its actually very fun to use however, sometimes it doesn't hear me, perhaps idk how to set it on the proper settings? Other than that i'm excited for the new games coming in the future. Best 500 bucks i've ever spent. One last thing if any of you do encounter problems thats normal all new things go through this like cars, iPhones, ext. so i personally think you shouldn't be afraid that the system is not going to function correctly because that could be fixed. Were all humans therefore not all technology or electronics are going to be perfect because were not perfect.

title: Just amazing
comment: System is absolutely amazing and way better then I thought it would be. Hoking up the TV was very easy and is very fun to use, you can change the channel and volume with just your voice and you can still use your regular remote to change channel and access your dvr if you wanted. Graphics are so life like and explosions and the sun are very bright, that's how clear the graphics are. System is VERY quiet and very quick and smooth. Microsoft really did a great job on this one. This is a must buy if you've had an Xbox 360 or thinking about getting one.

title: Great phone! Love everything about it!
comment: Lover everything about it! its bigger screen makes viewing videos a much better exprience. it has a much more interactive and personalization abilities. i can view my texts, talk and view the internet at the same time. this is a great and useful ability.

title: Good system with some short comings
comment:
This is a good system however there are some short comings that need to be addressed. For starters to be able to tie your live TV signal into the Xbox one it has to have an HDMI port, otherwise it doesn't work. If you do decide to run your cable/sat signal through the Xbox one you can not watch TV without turning on the Xbox one, also if you do decide to run your cable/sat signal through the xbox one you can not connect the xbox one to a home theatre receiver via hdmi hook ups. There is an optical audio port on the xbox for use with a home theatre receiver however if you have a 7.1/7.2 receiver you can only run at 5.1 using the optical audio port.
The controller feels cheap, the xbox 360 controllers feel much better in your hand, that being said it does function very well and is very responsive. The interface can be very frustrating at times consider it is little to nothing like the OS from the xbox 360, some of the basic menus and features are not present or are buried so far inside menu after menu that you may never find them.
On the overall this is a great system for playing video games, however the other features being advertised by Microsoft at least at launch have been greatly exaggerated.

title: Glad we purchased
comment: Our family picked up an xbox one with several games, Besides the first patch taking a considerable amount of time, the system has been great. We are looking at getting another unit as soon as we can find a store that has them in stock so we won't all be fighting over just the one. Love also the fact that the Kinect sensor works in a smaller space. Our living room is small and it picks us up in the room. If you get one of these, try the Skype app. Our kids call Grandma now through the Xbox and to her computer. We could have done this with our computer, but the Xbox makes it so much easier to do as a family.

title: The best computer switch a person could make.
comment: Started to purchase a Mac Book Pro, but discovered the size advantage of the Mac Book Air. It is so quick, simple, easy to setup and use. Unless you are an extreme gamer this is all the computer a person will ever need . Plenty of storage space for the everyday user and the overall size of the laptop is so easy to take with you anywhere you want to go. This machine has all the convenience that you enjoy with your iPod or iPhone and is a simple crossover for one Apple product to another. I would recommend the purchase to anyone that wants to really upgrade their computing experience.

title: We love it!
comment: We love everything about it and we are happy about our purchase!

title: Love it!
comment: We bought this for the kids to use for school. It has given them everything they need and more. It integrates well with their iPads they are required for school as well. It is great for the iMovie and publishing projects they are assigned.

title: great consol
comment: It is an amazing product xbox microsoft do it again great grafics and great games kinekt awesome

title: Lightweight and reliable laptop
comment: The Apple products are excellent, however the pricing makes it difficult to justify, however i have found that the Apple products have a longer useful life than some others which offsets the initial costs.

title: Excellent!
comment:
As an update to my Pre-Review from last week, This has been an excellent Launch Weekend. First to receive at my local store, Unboxed and hooked up downloading the Day One update at 1215. Zero issues all weekend on Forza5 and COD Ghosts. BF4 is alot of fun, but the online servers have had issues booting people. Kinect works great, As long as its configured correctly during setup process. Using the kinect does give you the best overall experience, I could care less if uncle sam was watching me...he would be BORED.

Pre-Bundled items are great, the headset connector (to the controller) seems tight and sometimes difficult to separate as im afraid ill pull the wires and fray them So i decideded to keep it connected. Aftermarket Headsets will reduce this issue in the future.

I understand there were some Xboxes being loud, running hot, etc, Sorry, mine is super quiet and has been on all weekend minus around 8hours of sleep since Friday morn.

title: Best System Ever
comment: I was not sure if I wanted one I am glad I got it. The set up was simple. Kinect movement and voice commands much better then original. Has many great features, love the fitness app, tracks your movements to see how well you are doing. Have problems with the TV connection after a download, I have a scientific atlantic cable box and I saw others had problems getting it to work also, but was mixed on it when it was working. You can not watch TV with out turning on xbox which I do not like. But the voice command with volume and channels was nice, especially if you are like me and are constantly losing the remote. All in all I love this system,

title: Just as I thought it would be
comment: Overall I'm glad that I purchased this, the games are awesome and enjoyable to play. However, you can't chat with you friends on the Xbox 360, so if you were expecting that and none of your friends are not on the Xbox one yet I would wait for at least a few friends to switch over, otherwise you will be stuck sending text messages to them all night long.

title: Very Versatile console
comment:
I am impressed with this console. I had no issues with my disk drive, set up for me took 15-20 minutes including the download. The games I have are Madden 25 and COD: Ghost and the look and play awesome.
I really don't see anything that is not so great. I am in optimist so I look at the positives. I see a lot of potential in this console. It is more powerful than the XBOX360 and look at all the things the XBOX360 did. It's just a matter of time before Microsoft updates bring out the full potential of this console as well. BE PATIENT!!!

title: Such a fantastic console! BETTER THAN EXPECTED
comment: This console is by far better than what i expected to be. With quick multi tasking and high end graphics game play with 60 FPS makes the image look so sharp and clean. The great ability where i can go back and forth from netflix to my game is almost instant with no buffering nor loading. Kinect Voice commands are such a great step from what the kinect used to be. With next gen blockbusters like titan fall and halo. This will be the console to get with such a fantastic look and feel I'm already excited to see it played on my console.

title: Awesome for GAMES and ENTERTAINMENT
comment: Purchased two of the day-one Xbox One consoles - one word = WOW!! Great gaming device - Madden and NBA 2K14 are incredible. The connection to DirecTV is AMAZING - I can voice command my entire entertainment experience. Movies, Music, TV, etc... I literally say "XBOX ON" and my entire entertainment system starts up and is controlled by voice, remote, and controller (any combination - very seamless). Great product - love it.

title: Best video game and media experience available
comment: I have owned every major console since the original Nintendo was released. The Xbox One is the best all around console I have ever experienced. Skype is amazing, we have two children and my in laws live a few hours away. Skype on the Xbox One is terrific, the camera zooms in and pans to who is talking or where the important movement in the picture is occurring. If I was looking for a video conference system that feature alone would be worth my purchase. I have an Xbox Music account, so all of my music is there automatically. I have SkyDrive so all of my pictures and video are available as well. Vudu, Netflix, Amazon Prime are downloadable apps which deliver unlimited entertainment. I can snap any app and for instance; my wife can watch TV while I play video games. We can browse the web while watching TV. Samsung and many others have tried to do this and the delivery is so so at best. The Xbox One shines as a hub of your living room. The fact that it plays video games is almost secondary yet is in my opinion the best all around console out there. I am very happy with my purchase and I know that the Xbox One will be in my living room for many years to come.

title: nice size
comment: a great phone for all around use...i wish the ringers were a little louder

title: In Love with Xbox One
comment: I picked my console up on release day and have had a blast since then. There is nothing else like the Xbox One. The online community is great, the games are gorgeous and the UI allows for the ability to multitask and use voice commands. If you get the chance, pick one up, you won't regret it.

title: Decent but far from great
comment:
Coming from 360 to Xbox One

Xbox One is a decent console right now. Theres a bunch of issues with kinect using voice and motion. Most games still run at 720p native. Xbox live is needed to use Netflix and other apps which should be free. Games aren't great right now. Interface is cluttered and not appealing. So I decided to return it and hold of till late next year.

2/5

title: An excellent system
comment: The graphics and sound are incredible. The interface, with the Kinect voice commands, works extremely well. Forza 5, in particular, looks and plays amazing. Very glad I got it and I can't wait for the titles coming early next year.

title: AWESOME FEATURES
comment: Love everything about it just wish the battery would last at least 9-10 hrs

title: My daughter's computer and she loves it.
comment: My daughter is a first year student in college. She thought about Pro, but elected to go with the Air and very glad with her decision. She is completely satisfied with her notebook. She has been an apple user for years and of course continues to love design, style, functionality, sound, portability.

title: The pinnacle of gaming
comment: The Xbox One is now hogging the TV in our living room as none of us can every stop playing on it! When we are not playing Ryse or Dead Rising 3 we are watching movies or listening to music. They really did a remarkable job with the new Kinect. The first Kinect was cool, but just a little too limited. With this new Kinect I can navigate the system and give commands while I am doing other things (like typing this review!). The Xbox One has all the apps I care about with more coming out all the time, but that main reason I bought it was because of all the amazing next gen games. And we haven't even seen what this thing can do once the game developers really start to push it!

title: Entertainment Guru
comment:
I purchased my Xbox One as a mystery item at the Midnight door buster sale. I'm a 40+ year old gamer with 4 kids that all use the 360. I purchased the X1 for its highlighted entertainment and because I want to play Forza 5. Since I returned home at 1240am I've been busy.

Hardware setup: crazy EASY! The directions to plug everything in was clear and simple. The cords and plugs feel sturdy and connected firmly.

1st Power up and setup: out of the box there is a little delay with no real indication that anything is happening. It was just long enough for me to get antsy so, turn it on and turn away (nothing spectacular to miss). As with all media there was a 500mb update and back to the start up. Only took about 8 minutes (high-speed internet.

Next - the Xbox then takes you through the basic setup. Very smooth and easy again.

I tinkered around with the apps and downloaded Netflix and NFL...like I said, 40+ YO, we have priorities.

TV - This was a feature I was skeptical about from the beginning so here it goes... WOW! I plugged my Xfinity Motorola cable box into the HDMI in port and in the apps section I located the Watch TV app and it started the setup automatically by identifying an input. In the next few steps the magic started happening when the Xbox learned how to talk to my cable box... my TV remote won't even do that. Next, the Xbox leaned how to talk to my Samsung Smart TV, this is when i was truly sold. I said "Xbox Watch Discovery Channel" the channel changed to Discovery. So I tested out the TV, "Xbox Volume Down" it lowered my TV volume by 2.

I also located in the settings where you can sync the TV to shut off with the Xbox or Turn on with the voice command (haven't made that work yet).

Finally, I also added a Bose CineMate GS Series II system and now the Xbox has learned that and controls that volume as well.

It is now 3:15am and I have not done the one thing the Xbox is so good at, played a game. i will follow up after a few hours of sleep but, I am VERY pleased with my X1 so far.

title: Best Computer I have Ever Had
comment: I have had this computer a couple months now and i will never own anything else again. Apple products are the best.

title: Awesome gaming experience!
comment: The graphics are amazing and the kinect feature is awesome. Can't wait to use the Fantasy Football experience on Sunday

title: Great computer for business
comment: This laptop is very thin and light weight which is great for carrying it back and forth from home and work. It takes care of every day tasks as well as complicated tasks with ease. For its price and effectiveness it is definitely worth the money.

title: Awesome Apple Product
comment: If you're looking at this, you probably know you want it. I bought mine after much research and it's perfect for me. I'm able to do everything I need to; download music, surf the web, general use. It's so light, and the trackpad is amazing to use!

title: Mostly What I Wanted
comment: Getting used to the Apple product takes time. The most disappointing thing is that I can't get my Hotmail email with the mail icon.. I do have a learning curve and it is coming along.

title: Easy to use and travail
comment: I use this computer for school essays, projects and daily personal use. It's a great computer and I highly recommend it to everyone. In addition, the costumer service was great and everyone was very helpful.

title: Great laptop!
comment: I really like my new Mac, it's such a huge upgrade from my old laptop. I'm very satisfied with it. No regrets!

title: Worth the Expense
comment: It is a very good laptop to use. It is worth the price. The display isn't one of the best, but the display is amazing non the less. Absolutely worth the price.

title: Best business laptop
comment: The best business laptop on the market, so light weight, feels fabulous to the touch. A pleasure to take on a work trip

title: Company prevents compatibility
comment: DON'T BUY THIS PHONE UNLESS EVERYTHING YOU WILL EVER HAVE IS FROM SAMSUNG> I am a big believer in open architecture for technology becuase I don't want everyone in my family to have the same computer, tablet, cell phone etc... to be able to work together. For a long time I told my friends that they should consider samsung products and in fact I have 2 samsung TV's, 2 Samsung DVD Players, my wife has a galaxy tab 3 phone and my kids have galaxy tab tablets. I have a IPAD from my work and a HP computer and printer, much to my suprise Samsung decided to block the ability to print from their devices to anything but a Samsung printer. I thought this must just be a software update issue but when I called samsung they confirmed it. This is very short sighted and has lost me as a customer and anyone who ever thinks they might want to use a non samsung device forever. As an FYI, Apple, Microsoft and all other android devices can print to the printer and I would recommend these options to you instead of Samsung

title: Awesome gaming system. Best on the market
comment: Xbox out did themselves this time. Great system with great grAphics and is quiet as can be.

title: Great gaming console

The snap feature allowing you to do two things at once is awesome, and there are lots of apps from Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Instant Video, etc built in. So far, all these features are working great and the only hitch is with the accuracy of the Kinect voice commands. I find it much easier to use the remote or Smartglass app on my smartphone.

The games require you install the first time you put in the disc. The controller feels great in my hand and is very responsive. I haven't had any issues with the system after playing for about a week. Its really cool being able to tell the Xbox what to do like turn it on or off. The only minor complaint I have is the limited games at launch. I have really enjoyed my purchase and would recomrecommend anyone getting one if you can find it.

title: Xbox One - Near perfect
comment:
Xbox One is a great entertainment source for the gamer/entertainer. If your a normal man who enjoys football you will impress your friends with the NFL features that are exclusive to Xbox like NFL Fantasy. The cable TV setup is a snap and surprisingly supports a no-name brands like mine. Nextlfix is back and is great to use but like I mentioned the UI for this and a few other apps could be better looking. I preferred Xbox 360's Kinect navigation and UI. The games as of right now are few and are lacking in triple A titles but that will change after Q1 2014 and the next gaming exposition (E3,Gamescom).

All in all it was a good purchase.

voice commands work perfectly, system plays quietly & stays cool over many hours of play. no problems with performance. snap is, well...it's a snap! i love switching from TV to my games effortlessy using voice commands, & the game downloads don't take nearly as long as i though they would, & you can begin playing them pretty quickly into the download process. only wish there were more great launch-day titles, but Forza 5 is definitely a great game & FIFA '14 should hold me over for a while.

great system overall & everything i wanted/expected from Xbox One. this system will truly be the center of my media home.

title: Perfect for everything and is portable
comment: The macbook air 13 inch is excellent. Compared to the 11 inch, it is far worth the extra 200 bucks. If you are going to buy a mac, do yourself a favor and get the right one. The 13 inch is just over 2 pounds I believe, and is no less portable than the 11 inch. The 13 inch is better for watching movies and using games, plus it gets a better battery life. I watched a 2.5 hour movie on medium brightness and it was still at above 70% when the movie ended! I also played batman arkham asylum and it ran fine on medium settings, and windows 8 through bootcamp I played skyrim on medium. Skyrim was perfect as well, I wss amazed. Not great on the battery but that is expected as it is no gaming computer. Great in every way, and no matter which macbook you get whether the air or new retina, get the at least the 13 inch (air offers 11)!!

Love the new xbox one. Can talk to the game while playing. Like that the kinect can see you. Can turn one tv and xbox by just saying xbox on. Lots more things you can do then xbox 360.
.

title: Awesome!!!!!
comment:
From the moment you turn on the XB1 you know you're in for a treat for years to come. My first game played was Ryse Son of Rome. Ryse's graphics is what you should expect from next gen consoles and more. Everything from battles to forests and the smallest details on the characters armor.

I have my Comcast box running through it. It works just like you saw in the pre release demos. Seamless switching from TV to games to apps. I love it!! My complaints would be the price and the lack of strong launch titles. Both complaints will be solved in time.

Assassins Creed 4, Dead Rising 3 and Battlefield 4 are incredible! I would suggest buying any one of those as your first Xbox One game! I gushed on Ryse only because it showed me what XBox One is capable of in terms of graphics.

title: Great system w/ a lot of potential
comment: Got the system the day of release and have been impressed with the voice commands (both in the games and in the xbox menu.) Although I find myself repeating myself at times at the Kinect I feel it's only a matter of time they do updates to clear up those issues. I purchased Ryse:Son of Rome as my first game and the graphics are great and gives you an idea of how great the graphics will be for future games. The voice commands for the xbox menu and tv are great. I only wish that I didn't have to kind of yell in order for it to hear my commands but it's not so bad. Overall, I would say that the XBoxOne is pretty good so far. It's still too early to figure out which system is better between the PS4 (I plan on having both anyway) but I'm really looking forward to Titanfall and other games that will be able to utilize the power of the system.

The interface is very smooth and easy to use, and voice navigation with the new kinect is a much better experience than on the Xbox 360. There are a few bugs with the kinect, and with time Microsoft will improve its accuracy. Give this thing a few more months and it will be a nearly perfect system.

title: Great console

I have battlefield for PC and it looks way better on the PC then on the xbox but the multiplayer is faster in level loads and wait times on the xbox. I enjoy having a console already ready to go on the TV then having to take the time to connect my PC and dealing with the keyboard and mouse when things don't go perfectly. So it was either the ps4 or xbox and I couldn't get hands on a ps4 so I was able to get the xbox and try it out. And so far I like it. I game on the PC most of the time but having a console is never a bad choice either. Just deciding to wait for games on the PC is the hard thing but they are getting better at timely releases lately since more and more people are acknowledging how awesome the PC is..

title: Total Entertainment
comment: Waiting in line on launch night for the xbox one and it was worth every second there. Quick and easy to set up with no hassle getting my 360 gamertag transferred over. Easy hdmi input from my uverse box. Smooth transition of the tv service. Game selection (as always at launches) aren't the greatest but the upcoming games will make up for it. Voice commands are simple but make sure you set up the kinect according to how it instructs you to on screen. Kinect is excellent and recognizes everything. The skype feature is cool as well, love how the kinect follows you around. Only thing I can complain about is how you can not input an external USB drive for other media like the 360.

The Xbox is definetly a great buy if your looking for more than just a gaming console. System has been working with no problems, but just like all firsts expect some issues down the road. Xbox vs ps4, I'd say get both.. if you cant afford it? Your good with either one

title: It is truly the "One"
comment: I can play games, watch live TV, watch videos, surf the internet, and even Skype from the same device. No more switching inputs and remote controls. Just say "Xbox On" and the "One" powers up. The new home dashboard is nearly identical to the Windows 8 operating system and is very familiar. It is all voice-controlled and you can change channels by naming them. The "One" is truly "Next-Gen".

title: awesome

title: Great system. Best of the next gens

Only negatives are the longish install times for games. I think this has to do with software updates being done at the same time. Also you have to download apps for simple functions like the Bluray player. Thankfully they are free and fast to install, just another step not to forget during the setup.

title: Exactly what I wanted in a media/gaming console
comment:
Bought it on launch day and I'm very satisfied with what I've seen so far. The launch games are what I expected in terms of quality, and I'm looking forward to developers pushing the capabilities of the system.

I love the TV/media integration. The interface is good enough to eliminate the need for a roku/apple tv. No need for another HDMI port, and gives more control without having to switch inputs.

I haven't gotten too deeply into the smartglass application, but what I've seen of it has potential.

The controller is slightly improved from the 360, but not too much. Still my favorite controller, so why change a good thing.

Overall, Microsoft has a solid offering with their new console. Time will tell how others feel, but my impressions have been positive and I'm extremely happy with it so far.

title: Great and fun product
comment: First xbox I have ever owned and I'm much pleased with the product. Would definitely recommend as a buy!

title: Lots of fun but still has some kinks to work out
comment:
So far I love the Xbox One. I have my tv running through the system to try out the voice control. The voice control is fun, you can tell the Xbox to start up a game, switch to an app like Netflix, switch to television, check your Xbox messages, etc. You can set up the voice control to control your Cable/Satellite box and your TV, it can change channels for you, example say Watch ESPN, it will change to ESPN for you, you can adjust tv volume among other things.

I purchased Dead Rising 3 and Call of Duty: Ghost. I am hooked on Dead Rising, COD is still sealed up but I am excited to get to it in the near future. I think the system could still use some tweaking, the voice control only works about 60% of the time, it seems if there is any background noise at all the kinect has a hard time hearing you without shouting and I feel like an idiot shouting at my tv! I am hoping there is a way to improve this experience or at the very least add a microphone functionality to the controller much like some of the smart TV's.

On a side note the right control stick on my bundled controller seems to be broken after a weeks worth of use, for some reason the up and down directions to not work at all, left and right are fine. Luckily I purchased a second controller, so far that one is ok, will be looking into getting the other controller replaced.

All and all I'm enjoying the system for the multimedia capabilities and the gaming capabilities. I'm not an Xbox fan boy by any means, this is the first time I've purchased a Microsoft system ahead of a Sony system but I couldn't resist the voice control and frankly most of my friends plan to purchase an Xbox One in the near future. I'm not super impressed with the list of launch titles, hoping to see a Gears of War or Halo sometime in the nearish future!

title: After a week with it, I'm convinced...
comment: While the real merit of the One will be realized next year with the release of games like TitanFall, Destiny, The Division, and the next Halo, current titles are certainly above average launch titles. The first time you answer a skype call and then jump straight back into gaming, or watching TV/Netflix, you will realize why Microsoft was right to push for making more than just a game console. Only gear enthusiasts will find compelling reasons to be early adopters, but this system will be in every serious gamer's arsenal in the very near future. A year from now, the dashboard and user experience will be almost certainly a different product when you turn the machine on. In the early days, though, the growing pains don't seem too prominent. There is a known issue with the TV app crashing that has a workaround. Just put the One in power saving mode in settings. It should be patched very soon.

My Xbox One hasn't suffered any significant problems. My controller did stop working after a few hours and I had to get a new one but it has worked flawlessly aside from that.
