title: i love apple products!!!! can't wait to learn more
comment: I have been wanting an apple laptop for a while but couldn't justify the extra cost. we have had an HP which was slowing down and causing problems and I have heard that apple products don't get the viruses or have the same issues as other laptops. I can't wait to take a class and learn all that my mac air can do!

title: Great Console
comment: I'm an avid gamer and the Xbox one although at first is complicated to use compared to the 360, once your used to the One, its overall a much better console.

title: Great phone
comment: Was not sure I would like this phone have always stayed with LG's but took a chance after reading reviews and they were so right great phone but battery life is the only trouble I have but have chargers at home and in the car so no big deal

title: Its alright
comment: The xbox one is a good system all in all. It is able to do many things and the games so far seem to be pretty appealing. However when i first opened the system and turned it on, i went to insert the game disk and it just would not go in. it was the whole disk drive not functioning properly. I immediately went online to see if anyone else has this problem as well and it turns out it is actually something wrong with the system itself and the whole thing needs to be unplugged and started up again. sure enough this actually worked and things were good for awhile. Next the microphone that comes with the system was not functioning properly as well. depending on which day i plugged it into the controller it would not pick up others talking or some days would not pick up on my voice. after a few days the whole mic stopped working and once again i looked to see if it was a common problem and many people are experiencing thing too. The system is good and i am happy i got it but for something to be this advanced and BRAND NEW i am disappointed with problems such as these. For the price it should be close to perfect.

title: First Mac computer. I LOVE IT!!!
comment: I love this computer. It is my first Mac and I will NOT be switching to a PC EVER again. It is easy to use, fast, slim, light, battery life is awesome! The speed is awesome and so is the power up speed. And not to mention all the stuff that comes with it (iMovie, iTunes)

title: GREAT
comment: I am a first time Mac owner and was nervous about switching, but it was simple and painless. Battery life is good, speed is great when online and is easy to navigate and use. Speakers are clear and apps like FaceTime are way better than other options. Totally happy with our purchase. The price point is a little more than other pc's and laptops, but we feel we made the best decision.

title: Love it. Easy to use
comment: I love the computer. It is easy to use. Everyone in the family enjoys it. I am probably going to stick with apple for all products. The people at the store were easy to work with and extremely helpful.

title: Don't wait
comment: I waited to long to buy this. I can't explain what is so great about the system, but it's so much better than the 360. If you're a Sony lover you may not love it, but I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

title: Good entertainment system
comment: Great entertainment and game system. Need more new games for this this next gen system...

title: Does everything I want right out of the box
comment:
I've loved this laptop. It's definitely worth every penny you spend on it, it's just a lot of pennies! But with how seamlessly it integrates into the rest of Apple's ecosystem, it's worth getting if you have other Apple products and plan on getting the most out of them.

Also, I have been pleasantly surprised that the base model gives me plenty of computing power and graphics performance. I'm not a power user by any stretch of the imagination, but I still spend quite a bit of time going back and forth between large documents and PDFs, while also watching lectures and multitasking with a variety of programs, and I've never experienced a problem.

title: Expensive but graphics are really good
comment: Was hesitant in buying it because of the cost but the graphics are really good on the games. The games are no more expensive then the regular xbox 360 ones but disappointed that you cannot play the xbox 360 games on this system.

title: Great laptop because of weight
comment: Overall a pretty reasonable value for a laptop, Apple should make cheaper stuff.

title: Great video game for family games
comment: Great video game, good variety of games. The console is too big, though.

title: Great phone, no need to wait for an iPhone
comment: This phone is the top dog right now, everything has been refined and works great, all radios,e.g. GPS, Wifi, Bluetooth excellent signals. Verizon didn't screw this phone up, typical bloatware but can be disabled. Would not wait for an iphone, this phone has everything. Feels good in your hand and with Best Buys buy back and the insurance programs, you can get piece of mind for the future of this phone. Great job Samsung, Verizon and Best Buy.

title: Best Phone Overall
comment: Best phone out there, hands down. If you don't have 4G LTE on this phone, you are not getting the full experience. Phone speed is awesome, response is amazing. Camera is one of the best out there. The AMOLED screen makes every picture look very real. This phone will be at the top of the food chain for a while.

title: iPhone Killer? I think so.
comment:
You can easily peruse the web for details about what makes this phone great. The hardware is ridiculous, and is the main reason I bought it...2GB RAM with dual 1.5GHz processors. It's slimmer than I imagined and lighter than my previous Droid Razr, but doesn't feel cheap. The new OS (Android 4.0 ICS) is really nice with a bunch of great features, like keeping track of your data usage from the phone, instead of what VZW captures, and then shutting off data at a preset limit. I wish some of the new features were more configurable, like the widgets built into the pulldown status bar. Of course, it's a smartphone, so don't expect great battery life, out of the box...although ICS has a nice feature to show battery life percentage remaining. I run though about 10% battery life every hour (about 10-15 minutes of straight usage, 45-50 minutes standby).

Seriously, the only gripe I have is that the volume keys on the left and the power button on the right are in bad positions. Virtually every time I press the power button (one-handed use), I accidentally change my volume settings...and vice versa, I'm accidentally pressing the power button when I just want to change the volume.

I have yet to root this one, but I hear it can be done, even with the locked bootloader. Not sure if I need to, though.

My rating: 4.8 (I rounded up to 5 for the star rating)

Go get it, it's worth every bit of $200 (or $250 for the 32GB version).

title: Excellent phone
comment:
I love this phone. After trying several different new Verizon phones, I've finally found the one I will keep. Everything about this phone is fantastic - it's lightning fast, utilizes Verizon's 4G LTE well, has an incredible (I mean INCREDIBLE) camera, and is wonderfully light but very sturdy.

I was worried the phone would be too big for me, but the size is great - very large screen but very easy phone to hold. My only gripe is that the screen, especially in direct sun, is less than ideal, due to the AMOLED screen. These screens just don't get quite as bright as LCD. However, otherwise I'm completely happy with everything else this phone has to offer.

title: Impressive
comment:
The S3 is a great device that packs countless features into a slim design. Despite its thin appearance, the phone feels substantial and comfortable when in use. I purchased mine in pebble blue, and the color is both attractive and unique. It’s something that must be seen in person to truly appreciate.

In terms of hardware specs, I’ve had no disappointments. The only concern I had was battery life, but even then, my worries were put to rest when I realized that I could easily pull off an entire day’s worth of usage without needing to scramble for an outlet. Transitioning to a “true 4G” phone, battery life was a primary concern, however the S3 manages to get through an entire day of moderate use with auto brightness and constant LTE connectivity. I live in SoCal and Verizon has definitely proved that its network is capable of providing top extremely reliable call quality and amazing data speeds. In practice, I’ve been getting download speeds ranging from 20-30 mb/s with upload speeds easily going above 12 mb/s. In contrast, I was never even close to approaching those type of speeds on my HTC G2 running on T-mobile’s HSPA+ network. With a 1.5ghz dual core processor and 2gbs of ram, the S3 phone provides an extremely fluid experience that is absent of any lag. It offers snappy performance and the phone never seems reluctant to perform a task.

Another factor that I took into consideration when searching for a phone was its camera. The S3’s camera is extremely fast and capable. It’ll be more than adequate for social networking websites and can even be deemed good enough to print. The camera’s software features a menu that is very well laid out and can even be customized.

Venturing deeper into the S3’s software, let’s not forget that this phone is running ICS with Samsung’s skin on top. Samsung has gone through great lengths to show people that the S3’s design was inspired by nature, and it reflects quite heavily in its software. Unlocking its screen and coming into contact with the device will reveal noises that mimic the sound of both flowing and dripping water. In addition to that, I was pleasantly surprised to wake up to sounds of nature and the outdoors for the default alarm clock. Overall, the S3 features what you would expect in a typical Android 4.0 device. Navigating through apps and menus is fairly simple, and with a screen this impressive, it makes things much more pleasing. The screen is simply remarkable, especially in it’s reproduction of blacks. It’s crisp and it features colors that I’ve never witnessed on any other handset.

The features that Samsung includes with this phone also enhanced my experience. Smart stay for example, which monitors a viewers face before timing out the display has actually proven to be quite useful. S-beam works perfectly for transferring photos. Other than that, I haven’t really tried it on any other type of file, although it seems very promising. My only complaint would probably be the accuracy of S-voice. It works for the most part, especially for simple tasks, however, it easily gets words confused, which then requires several trials to get things right. Other than that, the rest of Samsung’s S-features are quite useful.

Overall, the S3 is an amazing phone that never fails to satisfy. It’s speed and power are hard to match and it’s unique blend of nature inspired hardware and software help set it apart from competitors.

title: Best Phone I've Ever Had or Seen
comment:
Anyone in the market for a new phone (even fruit lovers) should put this top on their list. It has everything. Speed, looks, feel, function, apps, games, even good battery life. When I first held this phone I could not believe how it looked/felt. It was bright, colorful, light but solid. The sceen size and clarity blew me away. Its 720p Super AMOLED screen outshines most phones on the market. I love the look of the lock screen and live wallpapers.
The next thing I notices was the speed. Moving around menus and browsing the web was speedy, by far the fastest phone I've testes (I used to work for Verizon#. WIth a 1.5 GHz processor and 2 gigs of RAM apps and games will never studder. Also with 4G LTE speeds this phone is a beast.
Call and sound quality are great too. In fact, the only negative thing I can say is that S-Voice is as bad or worse than Siri #both are overated pieces of software that have too many glitches for my liking).
Samsung hit it out of the park with this phone. If you are thinking of getting this phone do it. You'll love everything about it.

title: I have no complaints regarding the phone.
comment: I owned the first Galaxy S and could not wait for the SIII. I am in no way disappointed. All that I have read about Jelly Bean makes me anxious for the upgrade.

title: So easy to use
comment: I LOVE THIS PHONE! I promptly sold my android and bought this phone after the short demo from the sales guy.

title: First experience Android...and it is good.
comment: After being a devout iPhone user for 4 yrs, I decided to give Android a shot w/ the S3. Thus far, i have not been disappointed. The Android OS is a bit different vs the iOs, but I'm getting used to it. To me, that was the biggest thing, as the phone itself works great. VERY fast. My only complaint is the phone does feel fragile since its relatively thin and made of plastic, and since its so big, I was fearful I might drop it. So I ended up getting an Incipio case which gave it some texture and it's been smooth sailing. DEFINITELY recommend.

title: Great Phone, Lots of Features
comment:
The phone is great. It has excellent sound quality. The screen is very clear, picture quality is excellent and mp3s play just as well as my ipod. I really like the calendar features which sync with Google calendar. This makes it easy for me to add entries wherever I may be and whichever platform I am working on. With all the apps available for the Andriod system, it can almost become a laptop replacement.

Since it is a smartphone, the battery life is an issue. I seem to be charging it daily. However, I am a heavy user of the phone and apps. I do have an issue with the on-screen keyboard and my fat fingers. But I am getting used to it. My previous phones had push button keyboards.

title: Fantastic
comment: Samsung hit a home run with this phone. There's nothing bad to say about this phone. Do yourself a favor a get rid of your stupid phone and get this.

title: Love it
comment: Great phone, Still trying to figure out all the features.

title: Gives no sim error and drops calls
comment: In marginal 4g areas this phone will drop your calls and give you a NO SIM error. This only applies to the verizon version. Do not buy it if you want to use it as a phone.

title: Great hardware, awful software
comment: At first I was absolutely in love with my S3. There is never any lag to be found, whether you're swiping through home screens or playing the latest games. The camera quality is excellent and takes pictures much faster than previous phones I've owned. I've always been rather impressed with the battery for the most part, as it lasts a full day easily. Things aren't all perfect, however. Within a few days of owning my first S3 I began experiencing a "No Sim" error. This would cause the current text I was attempting to send, or the phone call I was trying to make, to fail. The issue only happened once or twice a day at first, so I ignored it, thinking it was simply a fluke or a tower issue. A few days later I continued having it, and decided to exchange my phone for another S3. Within several hours of firing up my second S3 I began having the same problem. I had my SIM card swapped out, thinking it could possibly be a bad SIM card, but still, no cigar. It has been roughly two weeks since I swapped phones, and I am now having the problem several times a day. The issue only happens when you attempt to send a text or call, making it especially frustrating, as it interrupts whatever you are doing. As much as I love the hardware behind this phone, I am finding it hard to justify as my primary phone, as it can hardly function as that. I'm hoping this issue is fixed, otherwise Samsung will find this thing floating around on Ebay, as I will gladly go back to an older phone.

title: best phone I ever had
comment: I got this phone to replace my iPhone 4. It is better in my standards. It gives you much more customization than my old iPhone. The battery is just as good and I get a full day out of it. I'll just say you need to experience it to believe me.

title: Class of its own
comment: I have had my SIII for about a month now. The phone has impressed across the board. It has a top notch camera, great processor and even better on Verizon's 4g lte network you can surf the web and watch videos at the snap of a finger. The only problem I have had with the phone has been here and there, there will be a small bit of lag. Other then that the phone is the best on the market and in my opinion better then the 4s. Only thing the 4s beats the SIII in is the voice recognition. Other then that the IPhone is light years behind in my opinion. The phone is a must buy!!

title: Mixed
comment:
AT&T service at my home was horrible but friends with Verizon serviice had 3+ bars at my house. I purchased this phone and changed carriers from AT&T to Verizon at the same time. I preferred the Samsung over the iPhone 4 (features, screen size) but when I got home with it I could not talk due to weak signal. I borrowed a iPhone 4 and walked around my home with both phones. The iPhone 4 consistently had 3 more bars than the Samsung III. Bottom line - the iPhone had much better reception from the same carrier.

Your location is critical.

title: Nice
comment:
I like the phone. I think the battery life is too short.
Also hard to see when I'm in the sunlight.
Other than that, fun to use.

title: Great phone - has almost everything
comment: Best phone that I have owned. Still learning. Plenty of apps. Battery life can be short if radios are left running. Also have problem getting phone out of holster without disconnecting call.

title: New phone to replace iphone
comment: Nice phone with a lot of features. It is light weight and the screen is top notch. But, if you use your phone on the go with the need to make calls and navigate the screens with one hand, not so good. While big is great for watching videos and such, this screen makes it cumbersome to handle one handed. I am a very big man with big hands and even I found myself having to stretch my thumbs to activate widgets on screen. The number of steps to perform certain tasks were too many. To return a missed call, I had to touch the phone button, then touch the missed call button, then had to select between the call icon or the message icon, then had to hit the call button to actually start the call. Wow, what a lot to do to call someone back. I returned the phone and will likely go back to my former vendor. Pretty nice phone if you sit around, with two hands and a lot of time on those hands to play with your phone. Otherwise it's too much like an undersized tablet for those of us on the go.

title: Best color, screen size, and great pictures.
comment: It's a pretty nice phone overall. The only things I dislike about it is that I don't seem to get a good signal at my house and at work, so I'm constantly losing calls or my texts don't go through. I'd also like to know who decided to put the on/off button on the side of the phone opposite the volume button. When you try to shut your screen off, you end up pushing the volume button. Very inconvenient. They could have put the button on the top of the phone like all the other phones I've had.

title: Finally a Phone I can Love.
comment: Great Phone on Verizon finally, upgrade from the Thunderbolt, and the DATA works and no dropped calls. I purchased the S3 off contract, and it's worth every penny!

title: Good phone
comment: I have own several smart phone and I rate this one as being really good. It has good call quality and takes great pics. It is fast and I haven't lost any calls or had it lock up on me. It is a little big however I like to have a big screen to view so it works for me. The battery life is really good and I can always make it though the day without a charge. My only complaint is the auto bright. It is just always a little on the dim side for me so I often just manually operate the brightness on both the regular screen and the internet screen. It is also a little hard to see in bright sun light.

title: My first smart phone. Great phone etc.
comment: I found it easy to get around in it, I tend to jump in and do things and it let me! So far, my only issue is the battery life.

title: Great phone. Love it!
comment: This is by far the best phone I've ever bought. It's light weight, great picture, and good battery life. So far dropping it on a hard floor hasn't done damage.

title: not user friendly
comment: i heard all this hype about how great this phone was. it was just hype to me. the phone is difficult to use compared to previous phones I had, iphone 3GS and 4. 4G lte network is not that great an improvement over the iphone, sound quality of the calls and ability to make a simple call makes me wish I still had my iphone. apps are not better than the iphone, just different and sometimes makes me frustrated because when you want to delete and app, takes you more steps than with the iphone. a simple press and delete would be great. i am not a techie therefore this phone for me is not worth the money, i should've gotten an iphone 4S. But I will sure trade this phone for the iphone 5 when it comes out.

title: Warning.....this phone may be addictive!
comment: I love this phone! It's lightning fast, easy to navigate, and has awesome clarity. Way better than any Apple product!

title: awsome phone
comment: You will not be I-phone envy with this phone. Great features including exchange, great camera, large screen, and 4g service. Very responsive screen.

title: Excellent Phone!
comment:
This phone is amazing! Usually when I get any type of smart phone, I end up getting bored with it after an hour or so of use! This phone has so much to offer! The amoled screen is awesome! Love the fact that it's super light weight and has a great camera! Still haven't checked out all the features this phone has to offer!

The only thing I haven't liked about this phone so far is the predictive keyboard. I took care of the problem by downloading Swiftkey which is an awesome keyboard!

title: Thanks Samsung!!
comment: It's a great phone. The galaxy series has always been top notch and this is no exception.

title: overall great smartphone!
comment: Recommend this phone. But only if your comfortable with computers.

title: Amazing phone for moderate to advanced users
comment: I am very pleased with this phone. I upgraded from an original Droid and love this phone. It is easy to use, good pictures and video, very good sound quality, and amazingly large screen.

title: Great Phone
comment: This is a great phone if you have the cash and its size doesn;t scare you then you cant beat this. The phone works no problem you can hear people crystal clear and reception has been great. The features on this phone are killer and at first it prolly won't feel like its that fast(well at least for me) from you old phone but after using it you find the speed is seamless. The battery life is amazing I'm usually getting 12-16 hours of battery use out of the phone with mild to heavy use and at that time I feel I need to plug it in it is at around 25%-30%.

title: Great Cell Phone and etc.
comment: Cell phone met every expectation and then some. The camera and video capabilities were way above expectation. On recent vacation trip took over 1200 photos and 18 videos during European countries tour. Quality of photos and videos met result of medium>high priced cameras. On a trip, avoiding carrying excess items it tantamount. Phone's apps selection is extensive. Great product!!!

title: Love this phone
comment: I really enjoy my S3. I liked it so much I bought one for my wife and she is really enjoying it as well. The screen resolution is very sharp and the colors are vivid. The burst mode on the camera is incredible. If you have children in sports then this is for you. It is very easy to catch them in action. The set up and day to day use is simple. Battery life is to be as expected on a smart phone. This will last me all day from 7am - 12mn and still have 45% left on most days. Not too shabby.

title: Watch Out!!
comment: We used this phone for business and continually dropped calls where our other phones worked fine in the same areas. Very frustrating to say the least!

title: So glad I didn't get an iPhone
comment: It just works. Calling, msg'ing, GPS Nav, Music, Videos. Everything you want in a phone on a big screen.

title: Everything works perfectly
comment: I started with the Samsung vibrant, then I had the s2, this is everything that all of them should have been. It is amazing how far they have come.

title: Love all the features!
comment: Awesome Smartphone! I love the ease of use and versatility of an android phone. Can't wait to get the Jelly Bean update!

title: Great phone
comment: The phone has fantastic battery life. I use it for work as my primary phone. I can't talk on it all day and receive my company e-mail and still have almost half of the battery left at the end of the day. I never have had to recharge during the day. It has decent menus for an Android.

title: Best overall phone I've ever owned.
comment: I really like this phone. Once your familiar with some simple instructions (read the tutorials) it's easy to navigate through all the screens and functions. It's great for surfing, excellent pics and videos. Nice package of good apps are included. Texting is much easier (for me) with the larger keyboard. Most importantly, the sound quality is very good. However, I turned the motion function off. At least until I learn how to pick the phone up without causing it to flip randomly from one unwanted screen to another. Otherwise, it's terrific.

title: Best phone I had
comment: Much faster and nicer looking then the HTC Evo. HTC EVO is a good phone but this is a much better and faster phone. All I need to be 100% happy is to upgrade the OS to Android 4.1 Jelly bean. Oh, faster then my wifes new Iphone 5.

title: Syncs well, great camera, top phone
comment:
Syncs with google account much better than expected. There is no wait time between shooting pictures! Several phones were tested and compared before I chose this phone. It's a no brainer that this exceeds the iphone 5 in almost all categories. iphone 5 is just a thinner and slightly longer version of iphone 4s. nothing stood out with the apple phone. pics came out flawless

screen size and super amoled hd display is breathtaking on samsung gs3. they make iphone 5 screen look like a screen for ants. sleek white earbuds come with samsung phone and they emit superior sound, especially bass! i go thru lots of earbuds and these are the best so far, but maybe they are = to klipsh image s3 80 dollar earbuds.

internet browsing is lightning fast

title: For a first time user,there's a lot to get used to
comment: This is my first smart phone. There are no user guides, no CDs. You're on your own. I don't like that. There are too many things to learn without having a detailed guide. I want a manual that tells me all the options and how to use each one. Instead, I have to go to You Tube just to learn how to access my voice mail or a call waiting. The phone is good; it has a lot of features but it is hard to learn how to use all of them. And the first bill was like a bait and switch. I was charged activation fees, change of number fees, 411 fees, and pro rated monthly fees, none of which was I apprised about when I purchased the phone. They said it would be between $140-160 per month with no hidden charges. When all these charges appeared, I couldn't believe it. I had to call Verizon and even then, they only removed the change number fees. When this contract is over, I'm going back to the prepaid flip phones. At least, there, I know exactly what I'm paying. Oh, and by the way, the texting is attrocious! Every time you enter a letter, some stupid word comes up and you have to constantly tap their suggestion of what you want to write, erase it, erase the space it created and try to retext what you originally wanted. It is ridiculously time consuming and so stupid.

title: Not the S-equel you expect to the Skyrocket
comment:
Pros:
- The more "open" Android OS
- Large Display
- Crisp 8 mp Camera
- Slim with all-day battery for the average user
- Quad-Core Processor on CERTAIN networks
- "Generic" Power adapter: cheap accessories
- Split screen web view: surf and watch videos

Cons:
- like with other Samsung phones:
- Occasionally drops network (completely)
- Saturated Screen
- Apps/ App Data on local storage ONLY (same deal as with iOS;
Motorola allows you to use local and external indescrminantly)
- Bad gmail handles, inverting colors, making them unreadable
- For iOS users crossing over: completely seemless with some third party
assistance, except for iMessages- they will not go through
- While Google voice recognition is spot on, S-Voice (digital assistant) is quite often off the mark

Other Things Worth Mentioning:
- Uncomfortable at times to use with one hand- cannot reach
- Jellybean will introduce Google Now and a host of features that will take full use of this phone!

Conclusion:
I tested the phone for a good two weeks, being a previous Android and iPhone owner. Samsung definitely tries for the Wow-Factor, but Motorola has them beat in a lot of ways, most importantly stability. That said, this review was typed on an iPhone 5.

title: Samsung S3 Rocks
comment: Was standoffish to the large size at first and thought heavily about purchasing one of Motorolas fine products... glad I didn't. The S3 is an amazing tool for personal and business use. Bought one for both my wife and I and are definitely thrilled. Purchased an iPhone for my daughter at the same time and it seems like a relic compared to the Samsung. Screen size is excellent for all tasks and speeds are quick. Battery life is longer than expected and covers a full days use with ease. Quality unit and durable with an Otterbox case.

title: A nice bigger size
comment: Still learning about it. I had an old phone, so everything is just wonderful.

title: Eats the iPhone for Breakfast
comment:
I've always supported Samsung products. This phone replaced my Fascinate (Verizon's original Galaxy S.) I had been set on getting the 16 gig iPhone 5. Then I asked myself "Why 'upgrade' to a phone with a 4" screen and features that I've enjoyed on the phone I'm replacing for the past 2 years?"
After seeing the S3 in person I was sold. This is a mammoth of a phone, but it is thin even with a case. The size may be too large for some users, but I think it's perfect for viewing photos, content, and all around eas of navigation. I enjoy the large, crisp AMOLED screen, multitasking, the gestures are flat out awesome, and overall the battery life is better than my Fascinate. Smartphones in general, however, are in need of some sort of battery revolution.
I purchased the 16 gig S3 for cheaper than the iPhone 5 (and without a wait.) I poped my 16 gig microSD card in and suddenly had double the space. If I had to pick a flaw with this phone, it's that I wish the front facing camera took better quality photos. The rear camera is excellent, but the front doesn't seem to do as well in low light situations.
Be sure to pick up an S3 at a great price! It's an excellent value with impressive specs which are certainly futureproof.

title: Drops Calls
comment: Had the Galaxy s3 for three months now worked fine when I first got it. Now I get a No Sim card error, call Verizon and was told to change the sim card. Went to a Verizon store who changed the sim card and was told this will not help. He said there was a fix but noone nows what that is go figure. Not happy with verizon's service and had better luck with virgin mobile by the way is a no contract phone. Should have stayed with a no contract phone.

title: Excellent phone
comment: I have a number of android phones and even the first iPhone and I must say that this phone is hand down the best of them all.

title: GREAT! So much fun to be had!
comment: Awesome phone. As powerful as the iPhone but less expensive and not all the exclusive iPhone issues.

title: great camera and big memory capacity
comment: I am please with Samsong my previous phone was a samsong facinatey, I like it .and I even like the galaxy S3 more

title: easy to use, Great value, battery is wonderful and
comment: wow this a wonderful full feathered phone, camera, e-mailer ,easy to use, many feathers to find and use. Great app's. The sound is better then the phone I had

title: Great phone I was Sick of Apple
comment: first smart phone. Still use a Nextel also for work but enjoying this phone for personal use.

title: Couldn't ask for a better phone.
comment: This is the third cell phone I've had and my last one was an iPhone. My opinion is this phone is drastically better.

title: This is a great phone.
comment: This is a great phone and easily the best phone I have ever owned. My previous phone was an IPhone and the Galaxy S3 is easily the best phone I have ever owned.

title: Samsung has cutting edge technology but dissapoint

title: Great phone

The Kies software for desktop synch is very basic and needs usability improvement. All apps that I have tried have worked very well. Battery lasts all day too which is longer than I expected.

title: Great phone, happy I chose it over the Iphone
comment: I was torn between another Droid and shifting to the new Iphone. I chose the Droid based on the flexibility of the operating system and specifically for the integrated Google maps. I use the Google navigation often and it works flawlessly. My only issue with the phone is that phone reception does not seem as good as my previous phone. Low signal causing dropped calls and having to resend text messages multiple times. This coincides with Hurricane Sandy so I am hoping it is a function of loss cell towers and will get better with time.

Besides suffering in low-light situations (a problem with every camera phone), the quality and speed of this camera is outstanding. I don't feel the need to carry my point-and-shoot with me everywhere. Although i don't consider myself a heavy user the battery life is more than acceptable. Most days the battery is still at least 50% at bedtime.

title: excellent phone! take that apple!
comment: love it. bought another one a month later for a family member they love it. have recomended it to every one.

title: Outstanding phone and high quality
comment: Outstanding phone which offers high quality viewing and endless options for using. Would recommend to anyone who is considering an upgrade. Another great product by Samsung!

title: great phone
comment: This, so far, has been the best phone I've owned. I'm still learning all of the amazing features.

title: The Best Phone I have ever owned.
comment: This is simply a great smartphone. Simple to use, large vibrant screen, great sound quality. The best feature for me is the voice to text conversion. The conversion is almost flawless and editing the occasional error is simple, with a drop down list of suggested replacement words. My friend just upgraded to this phone based in part on my rave reviews.

title: Best phone I've ever owned or tested . bar none.
comment: I would recommend this phone to anyone. Great replacement for phone, music, apps . . .

title: what i phone 5?!?!?
comment: Solid phone and platform, does everything I need and more. Would highly recommend the Galaxy S 3 to everyday users and beginners.

title: Excellent phone, but call quality could be better
comment:
Upgraded this phone from an HTC Incredible. Has nice large display, beautiful screen, phone features are easy to use, overall love the phone.

My biggest beef is that the call quality is not as good a my HTC. Never had any issues with the phone at my house, where the reception is a little weak, but now I experience cutouts on calls fairly consistently. The other annoying thing is that occasionally the phone freezes when I am doing something. Have not been able to figure out why. I use a hard rubber case, and I wonder if it is because I push some combination of keys accidentally. Can't reset it except for taking the battery out.

If you can live with those 2 annoying things, this is a great phone.

title: Impressive overall
comment: Overall I'm prety impressed with the phone. Converting over from an HTC user I find the phone and messaging features a little cumbersome. (ie: time consuming with too many steps between searching for contact and actully placing the call or text) I make and recieve over 90 call a day, but I'm sure I'll get use to it. Many features I find better though.

title: Great phone
comment: I love this new phone. It isvery slim, big display, great camera, easy to use and I got it at great price.

title: Awesome Android phone
comment: Do yourself a favor and do a hard reset after you get this phone and you will see a great jump in battery performance. Samsung has made a hell of phone.

title: nice plane and simple

title: Very useful phone with so many options.
comment: This phone looks as good as it is... there are so many options and I can't wait to learn how to use them all so that I can better take advantage of all of its capabilities...

title: its a great phone
comment: cant go wrong with the samsung , overall this is the best cell i ever had, quality , pictures , sound ,

title: phone ok service isnt.
comment: had trouble from two weks of owning. tried tech support on several occasions. when finally found problem could not get a new phone only a conditioned one. feel this is not right for a new phone.

comment: Love this phone. Screen is great as is the processing speed. Phone seems very durable. Battery life is better than most, but still not phenomenal.

title: absolutely love it!
comment: I bought that phone at Best Buy, Gaithersburg , MD. The service was great, the staff was knowledgeable, friendly and very helpful.

title: Does what I want. Love the big screen
comment: Love the phone, but the screen cracks easily. This is my second one since August due to dropping the first one at a very short distance, about 12 inches off the ground and having no case on it. Otherwise all around good phone

title: Great Phone, excellent battery life, great feature
comment: I recomend this phone as one of the best on the market. I am 95% happy with it! Still learning its features.

title: Great phone with great reception
comment:
I bought this phone to replace my iPhone 4. It was a fairly steep learning curve especially given that I had to relearn all of the terminology and research what a ROM is what Rooting is etc. Yes, I rooted my phone as I use it in many ways that the stock ROM couldn't provide.

Excellent value for the money.

title: Great phone overall.
comment:
It is a great phone overall. When texting or on Facebook, it does not capitalize the letter "I". I have to hit the shift key every time. I didn' t have to do that on my last phone. Also, when in a screen on the web, if I click on another link on that page, it will not open it. It says that I have to close a page before I can open it. It should just go on to the next page.
But the phone does some really cool things. I love the Google maps. No need to buy a Garmin, etc. This one does exactly the same thing.
Takes great pictures. It is much faster than my last Samsung Galaxy.

title: Overall great phone, sketchy service in some areas
comment: I love this phone, it's like a mini tablet with great graphics and sound. My only issue (which is not so much with the phone, but my service provider) is that at my house, it doesn't get great service and my Droid got great service. Not sure why that is.

title: Very complex interface
comment: I tried it for two weeks and ended up going back to an IPhone 5 which works better for me. Great phone but not for me.

title: Fantastic phone!
comment:
I am having trouble finding anything negative to say about this phone. I have been singing its praises to everyone I meet since I bought it 5 days ago. I went from a 1st generation Motorola Droid to this, and have since said that didn't realize just how much I wanted a new phone until I got a new phone. The Galaxy S3 doesn't really do much of anything that the Droid couldn't do (except the S-Beam feature, which I have yet to use). It just does EVERYTHING better and faster. Much better... and much, much faster.

I was worried about the size, but it actually feels very comfortable in my hand (I have average sized hands for a man). The light weight and slim profile are great, and the size and shape are not so big that I can't fit it in my pocket (shirt or pant). I don't like holsters, so it will always be in a pocket for me.

The AMOLED display and Gorilla Glass touch screen are incredibly responsive (almost too much so... I sometimes find it difficult to use the keyboards because if I don't pick up my finger quickly enough, it will register the key next to the one I pressed - even tho my finger is no longer physically in contact with the screen).

The Samsung designers have a done a great job with the UI. The Notifications panel is very well laid out and has shortcuts and instant activation icons for so many tasks that I used to have to search through menus to find. The widget and Home panel layout is also very user friendly and intuitive.

The camera is quite good. It rivals any inexpensive dedicated digital camera for functionality and picture quality (IMO), and its controls are also fairly intuitive.

One gripe I do have is that the battery, while very good (especially considering everything I have been asking the phone to do over the last several days) is not all it was advertised as. The reviews and promotional info that I had read claimed a 22 hour battery life, and while I have not yet had to recharge it mid-day, I can't see it going 22 hours... maybe 18-20 at my usage pace. Now, to be fair... it has several power saving settings and features that I have mostly set to OFF, so perhaps if I was a bit more conservative about my approach, 22 hours would be realistic.

The S-Voice feature appears to work fine. I had heard that it wasn't up to the same standard as Apple's Siri, but I've never owned an iPhone, so I have no real frame of reference for a comparison. I do find that S-Voice works MUCH better than the voice recognition on my old phone.

Sound quality on the calls thus far has been adequate to above average. Not perfect, but more than satisfactory. No dropped calls yet and my listeners have told me that I sound much clearer than I did on my Droid.

So there you have it. I had to reach to find anything bad to say about it. The 4G-LTE is lightning fast (about 8 times faster on average than my high-speed internet wi-fi at home), and the price was fair and reasonable. Overall, it has been one of the best purchases I've made in quite some time.

I love this phone. Just love it.

title: Seriously easy to use phone!
comment: Finally a phone with a screen large enough to read clearly!!!

title: Great Phone for anyone
comment: This phone is better than the i phone 5. bigger screen 8 meg pixel camera with 1080p hd recording this phone is like the Kobe Bryant of phones that how good this phone is.

title: All around nice smart phone.
comment: Price is subjective as I got this when it was still pretty new and it will drop soon. Short battery life is just that. I keep a car charger in the car at all times as bluetooth is a drain on the battery. I also pretty much charge it every day. But it IS comparable to the other smartphones on the market.

title: Love it, overall.
comment: I like the phone overall, especially the camera, size, weight, etc. But, even after taking a training at Verizon Wireless store, I still can't figure out how to just 'kiss' the two phones together to transfer music, photos, etc. It looks so simple on the commercials, but it isn't. Even my high school senior nephew couldn't get our phones to share. If a teenager can't do it, no wonder two senior citizens can't figure it out, nor could the Verizon trainer at the workshop. Other than that, terrific phone.

title: An excellent smartphone
comment: This phone is quick, has a large vibrant screen, and lasts all day on a single charge under medium use. The screen does not stand up well to abuse though so you will want to buy a case. Even with the Otterbox Commuter case though it still fits easily into my pocket.

title: Great phone
comment: Great phone and the memory is great. Music is loud.

title: Great phone
comment: Wanted this phone since they came out. Glad I got it. If you buy the 50 dollar cover you wont have to worry about ruining your phone if ou drop it.

title: Very well made phone
comment: This is an excellent phone. As the Android vs. iOS debate is mostly one of which interface you prefer, this phone is a great addition for those on Google's side. The large, vivid screen is amazing and has great detail. If you're in the market for an Android phone, you can't go wrong with this unless you hate things that are awesome.

title: Great intro for first time smartphone users
comment: Just bought this phone in November. Switched from AT&T to Verizon. Never had a smart phone before. Love all the apps, the big screen and all the options. Battery life drains fast the more you use the internet or if you have apps that run all the time. Has a power saving mode that helps alleviate some of the power loss. Overall, a good phone for the price.

title: High quality phone. Intuitive to use. Nice.
comment: Nice phone with great quality. Size and weight are perfect. Being thin and having an oval edge..must have a case to make holding the phone comfortable. Screen resolution is stellar. The phone is pricey though.

title: Great phone
comment: Great phone easy to use. Needs to improve on the camera a bit. Overall I enjoy it. Friends changed from I-phone.

title: Nice size and options
comment: great phone and had no problems works great, great reception

title: Beats the iPhone
comment: This replaced an HTC Incredible. That phone was absolute garbage compared to the S3. My wife has the iPhone 4S, and we are both very familiar with IOS and Apple products, so I am quite confident saying that this phone also wins over the iPhone. I've read a lot of gripes about battery life, but it is VERY good compared to my old phone. It is the one area, however, where the iPhone is still ahead. For everything else (especially speed, screen size and clarity) I am still impressed with this phone and have had it almost 6 months. The glass is still as flawless as when it came out of the box. Buy this phone and there will be no question as to why Apple has gone after Samsung so viciously.

title: Very large phone
comment: I changed from the iPhone to the galaxy. I felt like I had a GALAXY in my hand. The phone is HUGE!!! Overall, the phone is ok.....maybe my phone was defective, but it CONSTANTLY freezes up, crashes & drops calls! I took it for repair. I'm used to 1-handed texting, but the size of this phone prevents me from doing so. I'm still trying to adjust my camera, as the pictures aren't of the quality I expected. The android network has added more apps that were previously available on my apple devices. I plan to keep my "universe," as I may grow accustomed to it later. Hopefully, my problem will be resolved soon. =-)

title: Phone is great for all of my needs.
comment: Samsung Galaxy III was a surprise. I didn't think the phone would be that much different than my Motorola Bionic but I couldn't be more wrong. It's a lot faster, less buggy and holds up to what Samsung has been raving about. People compare this phone to the IPhone but in my opinion there's no comparison, Samsung nailed it!!!

title: The phone that beat "da man" (iPhone)...
comment: Ask any cell phone retailer and they'll all tell you the same thing, this is the top selling phone outselling the iPhone. With its expandable memory, customizable appearance, numerous different launchers to download and movies and music it will not take long for you to realize why this is outselling the iPhone.

title: Great all around phone. A true flagship device
comment:
I have used this device for around 2 months now. This is hands down the best device I have ever used.

The transitions between home screens and apps is seamless and fluid. The phone is intuitive and TouchWiz is a joy to use. i would recommend this phone to any beginning android user and very knowledgeable ones alike.

title: WiFi is almost useless.
comment: Review would be 5 stars except the WiFi works only sporadically. I have to reboot cable modem and router before it will connect to the internet. Then it only works anywhere from a few minutes to 2 hours. I have several other devices including a 3 year old Motorola Droid that connect without problem. Android forums on the web report numerous WiFi connectivity issues. I am taking the unit back to the store to see if replacing the phone solves the issue.

title: A Galaxy Upgrade
comment: I upgraded from the Galaxy SII. It's all together a better phone. The new features are fun to try out, but not a game changer. I'm glad I stuck with Samsung/Android/Galaxy.

title: Good large screen.
comment: Good phone and camera. The larger screen I like.This is my first smartphone, and it was a good choice.

title: I am still learning all of the features
comment: This is my first smartphone and it is wonderful. It is easy to navigate and will get easier as I learn all of the features.

title: one of the best phones I have had yet
comment: I cant wait to see what will come out next for the Galaxy class

title: Great phone
comment: as a newer user to smart phones, i find this phone to be very easy to use. i am texting more, using facebook and other options. very nice phone!!

title: great all around phone
comment: This is really a great phone. The video playback is superb. The size of the screen is great and makes it easier to see and operate. I really don't have anything negative to say about this phone. Highly recommended!

title: great for music
comment: Great phone but the glass is too easily cracked. Very expensive to repair. Samsung needs to fix this defect.

title: Awesome phone
comment: This phone is so much more than I expected. Was 100% sold on the iPhone and by the time we left, walked out with the Samsung. So happy the sales associates took the time to inform me of all the great features and high quality this phone exhibits. Larger display screen than the iPhone too!!

With S III the alternates pop up and you select the desired one. It is much faster than spelling out the whole word, And it can learn your favorite words, names, etc.

title: Great range and call quality
comment: Wanted a 'smart phone' with excellent call quality that would also keep me connected to the internet and my email and this phone seemed to fit hat need. I don't like that it is Google driven and useful apps. are generally difficult to find, install and in some cases use. A very powerful device with limited use unless you have a geek tattoo and hours to spend playing with this thing. For the record I'm a semi-retired electrical engineer and this phone might actually baffle Tesla... nonetheless I love it.

title: Best phone I have ever owned

I am completely happy with my decision and have not really found anything other than battery life to complain about. The battery life is still much better than I had before but I would like to be able to make an entire day on one charge. This is due mostly to the building I work in so I really don't blame the phone.

title: Excellent phone. Huge points with daughter
comment: Bought the phone for my 15 yr old daughter as a gift. Decided on this phone because of great reviews. Phone works great so far. Good signal strength (Verizon), excellent picture quality and good sound quality. The battery life is good considering all the texting.

title: awesome computing speed
comment: Awesome phone. Couldn't be happier....................

title: has problems with hotspot
comment: love the phone but I never can get the hotspot to work n battery life sucks. but its easy to use n understand..

title: Great phone!
comment: I have had the S3 for a month and a half now and I really like it. It is so fast compared to the Droid x that I came from. I put a 25 GB card in it so have lots of storage room for pictures, music, documents and books. The screen is really responsive, almost too much so sometimes! I did put the zagg shield on it and an otter box commander so that it will be protected as it was very slippery. Everything that I use runs so much easier and faster on this phone. I was worried about the call quality as we live in a rural area but it has been great, and music sounds wonderful on it. I haven't figured everything out yet but love the fact that it is like having a computer with me. It also works well with my Galaxy tab 2. The Samsung calendar syncs between them so I am always up to date.

title: Loving it and now my son wants one too!
comment: Going from an old flip phone to the Galaxy S III was like going from 0 miles an hour to 100 miles an hour, but the learning curve I needed (and thanks to a son with the patience of a saint) was so well worth it. Now I'm asking myself what took me so long to join the new millenium!

comment: Love this phone, lightweight, user friendly, great pictures, perfect size!! Battery life is pretty good - better than the previous droid phone I had. It is easy to maneuver through the apps and settings and that's fantastic. One thing that I have trouble with is when I'm texting it is easy to hit a button that wants to insert unwanted pics, smileys, links and I'm not sure what I am hitting that keeps doing that. Would definitely recommend this phone to anyone looking - so glad I picked it instead of an iphone!!

title: good battery life

title: iPhone 4 Replacement!
comment: Light, Clean, Functional, Great Screen, Great Apps, Dictating to text and ALL other Apps, OS and Apps are always current!!!

title: Love my phone!!!

Other than that it is totally user friendly, sharp pictures, great sound and overall just easy to use. I love my phone!!!

title: takes getting used to
comment: I decided to join the 21st century. Several people recommended this over the iPhone so I got it. This thing is frustrating, but maybe the iPhone is also... I don't know. I'm not a tech geek. And I don't text or surf or play games or send videos. Primary reason for buying: larger photo display and better resolution than my cell phone, access my email, search the web. Give me my old cell phone for phone calls: the touch screen for phone contacts and making calls is so sensitive that I have to be sure I'm calling the right person. The worst thing about it is I have to have a case and carry it or wear it on my belt. Why? Because just the movement of my pants against the screen activates it and it keeps "blipping" until I remove it. Can this be addressed? Maybe, but as yet I didn't go searching on the web to find out. My fault: yes. But you wanted my opinion so here it is.

title: Amazing phone

The GS3 is much thinner too, so even with the Urban Armor Gear composite case I added, it's just the right size to fit comfortably in my hand. I was pleasantly suprised by the better sound quality on both sides of the call. Another plus is the standard battery that comes with the GS3 has a longer life than I expected (2-3 days between charges). This phone is so loaded with features, it will take you a while just to try them all out yet. I've had my GS3 for two months now, and it still impresses me!

title: great phone

I can't always tell how much Data I used but I think that is a user problem, again not the phone.

title: Great phone

Is there some kind of software glitch in the phone?

title: great phone for a technically challenged person

title: Excellent with minor problems

What a difference when compared with The Weather Chanell. Second problem: in my wife's iPhone it's very easy to look up a definition of a word in a text, either an article from the Internet or from an email. I have not been able to do it on my phone. I'd be happy

title: very nice phone, long learning curve

title: Great phone for the eyes
comment: I love this phone. With the size of the screen, I am able to use it more than my previous phone to check my e-mail, facebook and look things up on the internet. I don't like the battery life, but if you clear out your task manager and memory daily, the battery will last longer.

title: My first data phone and like it
comment: The product reduces my need to have a computer with me all the time. It makes research handy and provides activity during dead times. It will take some time to learn all the features but it was immediately useful.

title: love it
comment: so far I love it- the true test will be when I am away from a charger for 8 hours or so to see how well the battery holds up.

title: Best phone ever.
comment: This is the best phone, I ever had. At the time of upgrading my phone, I was in debate to chose Samsung galaxy S3 or iPhone 5 and I made the best decision to chose this phone.
